loans.name: Améyo Reine

texts.en:
Améyo Reine A. is a young woman of 34 and works as a merchant in the village of Agbanakin in Les Lacs prefecture. As a mother of three children, she also covers most of the family expenses; her husband is unemployed. Various grocery items compose the majority of goods she offers in the open-air display she has set up. It must be emphasized that the income derive from this business is directly used to cover daily expenses, making it difficult to save any money. In order to build a shed for protecting her display of goods, to increase customer orders, and to boost her sales, she is requesting a loan of $750.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

Jeune femme de 34 ans, Madame A. Améyo Reine est commerçante dans le village d’Agbanakin dans la préfecture des Lacs. Mère de trois (03) enfants, elle supporte la plus grande partie des charges de sa famille ; son mari étant sans emploi. Les produits d’alimentation générale et divers sont les principaux constituants de son étalage dressé à ciel ouvert. Il faut souligner que le revenu tiré de ce commerce est directement investi dans la consommation quotidienne, ce qui rend difficile l’épargne. Afin de construire un hangar pour abriter son étalage et augmenter ses commandes afin accroître son chiffre d’affaire, elle sollicite une somme de $750.

loans.use: To build a shed to protect her display of goods for sale and to boost customer orders

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase inventory and grow the business

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.es:
Jennifer started her business 5 years ago with the little capital she obtained from her previous job. Every day she attends to each customer personally, working from 6am-10pm. Her management experience and the quality of products she offers to her customers helps her maintain her business. She sells supplies, pharmaceutical products, and faux jewelry.

Jennifer asks for a loan to invest in the aquisition of new and various products and to finish renovating her shop so that she can better display the products and, thus, improve her services and public attention.

Jennifer is 30 years old and single. Since a young age she worked various jobs and obtained a lot of experience. She had to close her first business, an eatery, because it was a rental establishment. This motivated her, along with her parents, to start a supply store, selling medicines and jewelry, too. The business occupies part of the house, which is under construction. Her goal is to improve her business and profits to continue the construction of her house and to be an example for her brothers.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Jennifer inicio su negocio hace 5 años con un pequeño capital que logro obtener en base a las ventas de su anterior trabajo. La atención de su clientela la realiza de manera personal todos los días desde las 6am-a -10pm. Su negocio se mantiene gracias a la experiencia obtenida en el manejo y calidad de productos que Jennifer ofrece a sus clientes. Ella vende viveres, productos farmacéuticos y bisuteria.

Jennifer necesita del préstamo para invertir en la adquisición de nuevos y variados productos así como también terminar de adecuar su local para poder exhibir de mejor manera los productos que ofrece a su clientela mejorando de esta manera el servicio y atención al publico.

Jennifer tiene 30 años es soltera no tiene hijos. Desde muy joven se intereso por trabajar siendo empleada en distintos lugares donde adquirió experiencia. Siendo su primer negocio un comedor el cual tuvo que cerrar por que el local era de alquiler. Razón que la motivo para que junto a sus padres decidiera iniciar su propio negocio de venta de víveres, medicinas y bisutería. Ocupando parte de su casa. Su vivienda esta en construcción. Aspira mejorar su negocio e ingresos para seguir ayudando en su hogar y ser ejemplo para sus hermanos.

loans.use: To invest in merchandise

loans.name: Vahobjon

texts.ru:
Vahobjon is a very modern energetic man. He is 38, married, and has 4 underage children. The entire family is engaged in Vahobjon’s business. Vahobjon has a retail spot on Isfarinskiy bus terminal, where he and his wife, with the help of their children, sell small goods including fried sunflower seeds, chewing gum, cigarettes, etc. In addition, Vahobjon rented the bus terminal’s public bathroom, which he now maintains, and earns an income by charging an entrance fee. Vahobjon personally travels to the regional center to purchase his goods. He received the first MicroInvest loan a year ago. Having received a few loans, Vahobjon significantly expanded his business. His next loan, Vahobjon plans to use to purchase sunflower seeds, as the season of low prices is approaching.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Вахобчон очень современный и энергичный мужчина. Ему 38 лет, он женат и у него 4 несовершенолетних детей. Вся его семья занимается бизнесом и всем этим он управляет. На Исфаринском автовокзале у него есть торговое место, где он и его жена торгуют мелкими товарами – жаренными семечками подсолнуха, жевательной резинкой, сигаретами и т.п. здесь им помогают их дети. Также Вахобчон взял в аренде общественный туалет при автовокзале, где он следит за порядком и получает от этого доход в виде оплаты за вход. Вахобчон также сам ездит за товаром в областной центр. Кредитоваться в Микроинвест он стал год назад. Получив несколько займов он значительно расширил свой бизнес. Очередной займ Вахобчон хочет получить на закуп семечек подсолнуха, так как скоро наступает сезон снижения цен на них.

loans.use: To purchase sunflower seeds

loans.name: Chao

texts.en: Mrs. Chao P., age 38, works with her husband selling vegetable at a busy market, earning around $9 each day in revenue. They have three children: two who are students and one who is too young to attend school. She would like to request a loan of $1200 in order to purchase a stand at the market so they do not have to spend a great portion of their income each month to rent a stall. This will increase their income and help them finance their children’s education. Her husband is pictured in the photo as she was not available at the time.

loans.use: To purchase a stall in the market to sell vegetables so they no longer have to rent.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand her business that is a bazaar

loans.name: Dira B Group

texts.en:
Edward, age 38, is married with 4 children (ages 15, 12, 10, and 8). He owns a cafeteria business which he began 2 years ago. His business is open from 5am to 11pm daily, and makes a monthly profit of about $164.

Edward hopes to take a loan from Tujijenge Tanzania to increase on his business. He will be sharing this loan with sub group members, who have businesses dealing in a retail shop, selling food stuffs, and a kiosk.

In the picture, Edward is in the centre.

loans.use: To increase on business

loans.name: Dilbarjon

texts.en:
B. Dilbarjon is 44 years old. She is married and has two children. 

For the past 15 years, Dilbarjon has been selling bread in the local market. She mainly sells white and brown bread as well as rye rolls. The business is rather stable and allows Dilbarjon to improve the living conditions of her family.

Currently, Dilbarjon is asking for a loan of US$600 for a term of 6 months in order to be able to purchase flour and bread for sale. Dilbarjom has borrowed from IMON in the past and promises to pay the loan back in time.

loans.use: Purchase of  flour and bread for sale

loans.name: Kisenyi A(2051) (I) Group

texts.en:
The leader of this small group is Betty Afukoit. She has a retail shop and is requesting a loan to add to her stock. Betty is 30 years old and is married. She has 5 children ranging from ages 5 to 15, and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

 Betty is joined in her small group by Harriet N., Justine N., Regina S., and Betty N.. Harriet N. sells used clothing and wants to increase her inventory. Justine N. operates a restaurant and wants a loan to purchase more foods and dishes. Regina S. operates a retail shop and wants to purchase a refridgerator. Betty N. has a retail shop and is requesting a loan to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase more shop commodities

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is 54 years old and lives with his family in the Bekaa Valley. He has six children and makes a living selling food to his neighbors. This is the first time he has applied for a loan from A. Majmoua. He will use the proceeds to buy more of the provisions he needs to run his business.

loans.use: to buy provisions

loans.name: Nelida's Group

texts.es:
Yessy, Fabiana and Nelida have been members of the communal bank called Chacco for 2 years. They are from the community of Chacco which is located about 30 minutes outside of Ayacucho.

Yessy is 33 years old and married with one child. For two years she has had a small shop where she sells drinks. Fabiana is 38 years old and also married, with 3 children. She has a shop where she sells grocery items. She also grows vegetables which she sells in the market of Nery Garcia. And Nelida is 27 years old and married with 2 children. She works as a nurse but right now she is pregnant and not working. She also grows vegetables.

These women will use the loan to purchase stock for their businesses, such as sodas, beer, noodles, cooking oil, soap, seeds and fertilizers. They all share the dream of being successful professionals, improving their houses and growing their businesses.

Yessy, Fabiana y Nelida pertenecen al Banco Comunal Chacco hace 2 años. Ellas son de la comunidad de Chacco que esta ubicado a 30 minutos de la ciudad de Ayacucho.

Yessy es conviviente, tiene 33 años y 1 hija, Yessy es conviviente, tiene 33 años y 1 hija, Yessy tiene una tienda donde vende bebidas, actividad que realiza hace 2 años.

Por otro lado Fabiana es conviviente, tiene 38 años y 3 hijos, Fabiana tiene una tienda de abarrotes, además Fabiana se dedica a la agricultura de verduras que vende en el mercado Nery García.

Mientras que Nelida es conviviente, tiene 27 años y 2 hijos, Nelida es enfermera pero actualmente no esta trabajando por su embarazo. Nelida se dedica a la agricultura de verduras.

Yessy, Fabiana y Nelida necesitan préstamos de 900 soles, 1500 soles, 600 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de gaseosa, cerveza, fideo, aceite, jabón, semilla y abono.

Los sueños de Yessy, Fabiana y Nelida son que sus hijos sean profesionales, mejorar su casa y su negocio sea más grande.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE STOCK FOR THEIR RESPECTIVE BUSINESSES SUCH AS SODAS, BEER, NOODLES, OIL, SOAP, SEEDS AND FERTILIZERS.

loans.name: Neang

texts.en: Neang S. is 52 years old and lives in Kampong Cham province. She is one vegetable seller out of many in the province and earns about 2 US$ per day. Her husband drives a horse drawn cart which is used to transport everything from fruit to people from place to place. He earns 2.50 US$ per day. They have two children but are too poor to be able to send both the kids to school consistently. Right now, the children help the parents in their work each day. Neang S. wants to apply her loan towards a new horse for her husband's business. Her husband is pictured here at the CREDIT office as she was unavailable to be photographed.

loans.use: To buy a horse.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Mrs. Claudia C. is 39 years old and is married to Mr. Alejandro Silva who is 51 years old, they have 7 children studying in high school. Mrs. Claudia has worked as a maid for many years, her husband is a storekeeper and with their savings they have been able to purchase a house and put a pantry in it. They live 10 kilometers from the center of the city in a house; she has already formed customers that are mostly her neighbors. She would like in the future to open a small supermarket because there isn't one in her neighborhood and it is a necessity for the locals. The loan will be invested in the purchase of rice, noodles, milk, bread, sugar, sodas, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Claudia C. posee 39 años esta casada con el señor Alejandro Silva de 51 años, poseen 7 hijos cursando actualmente la secundaria.

La señora trabajaba como empleada durante varios años, su marido es comerciante y con los ahorros de ambos lograron comprar para su casa y poner para su despensa. Vive a unos 10 km. del centro de la ciudad en una villa, posee una clientela ya formada que en la mayoría son sus vecinos.

Le gustaría en el futuro abrir un pequeño supermercado ya que en la zona en donde vive no cuentan y es una necesidad para los habitantes del lugar.

El préstamo será invertido en la compra de arroz, fideo, leche, pan, azúcar, gaseosas etc.

loans.use: to purchase rice, noodles, oil, eggs, cheese, bread, and sodas, etc.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is 28 years old. She has two children, ages 10 and 14. In 2005, she began her own clothing and perfume sales shop. In one month, Halima earns a profit of around $65 from her sales.

Halima would now like to request a loan to increase her inventory of clothes, and expand her business range and clientele.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Ezequiel

texts.es:
Ezequiel has his own home (on Antofagasta Street in the Pasankeri zone of the city of La Paz). He is a widower and receives a retirement pension on which he supports himself, covering only the most basic necessities. The loan he seeks is for refurbishing one room in his house, which he uses as his bedroom.

His previous history is favorable, and we qualify him as a good client.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Ezequiel tiene casa propia (calle Antofagasta de la zona de pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz), es viudo y percibe una renta de jubilado con al cual se mantiene y puede cubrir sus mas mínimas necesidades. E El crédito que solicita es para la refacción de una habitación, la cual es su dormitorio. Su antecedente histórico es bueno y lo calificamos como un buen cliente.

loans.use: Making improvements to his home.

loans.name: Azer

texts.en:
Azer A. is a 43-year-old man who lives with his wife and two adorable children in the small village of Saatli region. He sells women's clothing in the local bazaar. He started his business in 1996. He is not alone in his business; his wife actively helps him to sell clothes. 

Selling clothes is the only one financial source in his family. Azer goes to capital of Azerbaijan, Baku, to purchase new clothes every week. He has applied for a loan of $1200 USD to purchase women clothes for winter season. 

Let's wish Azer good luck in new season!

loans.use: To purchase women's clothes for winter season

loans.name: Deysi

texts.es: Sus aspiraciones desde muy joven tuvieron que ver con la venta de ropa, es por eso que Deysi es una excelente vendedora de estas sus prendas, tanto para adultos, como para niños, las cuales también, a veces, las deja al crédito. Tiene 37 años y 2 hijos, los cuales están estudiando, y a quienes quiere brindarles, por el momento, sus estudios, hasta que se decidan por una profesión ser. Su esposo pareja Máximo, trabaja independientemente, y está de acuerdo con todo lo que ella decide respecto a su negocio.  La meta trazada de Deysi, es crecer e implementar su negocio, complementarlo con algunos otros accesorios, pero para ello necesita de un capital  para lograr su objetivo. Apoyemos a la señora Deysi, madre talentosa, que se esfuerza arduamente por prosperar.
texts.en:
Her aspirations since she was very young had to do with clothing sales. It's for that reason that Deysi is an excellent salesperson of these clothing items, both for adults and children. Sometimes she sells on credit. She is 37 years old and has two children, both of whom are studying. For the moment she is focused on their studies until they decide on a profession. Her husband Máximo works independently and is in agreement with everything she does with respect to her business. Deysi's goal is to grow her business complementing it with some other accessories but in order to do that she needs business capital to reach her objective. Let's support Deysi, a talented mother, so that her hard work will allow her to prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase additional clothing to sell

loans.name: Gulruhsor

texts.ru: Кодирова Гулрухсор. 21 год. Не замужем. Живет с родителями в городе Нурек. Два года занимается бизнесом. Торгует фруктами на центральном рынке. Скупает товар у дехкан и продает по розничной цене. У нее много клиентов , но для развития бизнеса хочет увеличить ассортимент товара, путем получения кредита. Это поможет увеличить объем продаж и прибыльность бизнеса . Погасить кредит сможет в течение 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Gulruhsor Q. is 21 years old. She is not married, and lives with her parents in the city of Nurek. She has been in business for two years. She sells fruits in the central market. She buys from small farmers and sells at retail prices. She has lots of customers, but would like to use a loan to further develop the business by expanding the variety of goods she offers. This will help to increase the business's sales and profit. She will repay the loan over 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase sales

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
This is Samuel Abdul M., age 36.  He was born in Magburaka town, Tonkolili District, in northern Sierra Leone. Abdul is married to a businesswoman and the two have four children. Three of his children are in primary school and one is in secondary school. Abdul runs a video center (a cinema with several 19” televisions) where he shows movies and European soccer matches.   People of all ages come to watch Premier League, FA Cup, Carling Cup and European Championship Cup matches.  Once in a while, he’ll also televise the German, Spanish and Italian league games.  He has never received a loan from SMT before, but is now applying for one to help him strengthen his business.

With this loan, Abdul will make a great improvement to his operation. Currently, he is using two satellite dishes, but this is not enough. These dishes cannot show all of the above-mentioned matches. Abdul will therefore add some of his own savings to the money from the loan to buy a new satellite dish that can show all of the above-mentioned matches. He will travel to Freetown, about 240 miles round trip, to buy it. 

Not having the third dish has been Abdul’s greatest challenge in his business. Many customers deserted him because of his inability to show all of the matches. But with this loan, and the dish that he’ll be able to buy, he is optimistic that he will be able to regain all of his lost customers and even find some new ones. Many of the youths in town prefer his video center to others because of its convenient location in the center of town. In addition to having a good location, he is young and many youth like patronizing with him because of their similarities. Also, as chairman of the Motorbike Rider’s Association, he is very popular among the many motorbike riders.

When business improves for Abdul, he will be able to take good care of his family, pay school fees, and provide them with more food and clothing.

loans.use: buying a third satellite dish for his video center

loans.name: Béatrice

texts.fr: A. Béatrice est née le 18 janvier 1970 et elle s’est mariée avec BOUSSOUDAHO Hubert. Elle a arrete ses études au secondaire. Elle a 6 enfants âgés de 19, 11, 9, 7, 5, et 3. Il y a 6 ans elle a commencé son activité de vente de vivres et le charbon. Il y a 3 mois elle a commencé la poissonnerie. Dans le futur, elle voudrait developper sa marchandise.
texts.en:
Ms. Béatrice A. was born on January 18, 1970 and is married to Mr. Hubert BOUSSOUDAHO. She ended her studies in middle school. She has six children, ages 19, 11, 9, 7, 5, and 3. Six years ago, she began working, selling staple goods and charcoal. Three months ago, she started selling fish. In the future, she would like to develop her merchandise.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish

loans.name: Bakhtiyor

texts.en:
Bakhtiyor Y. is 33 years old. He works with livestock. He buys and sells cattle from different marketplaces and has been in the business for the last 10 years. His main customers are butchers and livestock farmers. He is requesting a second loan after successfully repaying the first one.

With the previous loans, Bakhtiyor has been able to increase the number of cattle that he trades. He is married and a father of three children. With the loan from Kiva, he plans to increase his herd of cattle for trade and, if possible, open up his own butchery. This, he says, will increase his turnover. He plans to see his children go through higher education and unlike himself, be able to get good jobs.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cattle in order to expand his business

loans.name: Marizol Azucena

texts.es:
Marizol es una mujer fuerte de 35 años, vive junto a su hija en casa de sus padres, ubicada en el distrito de Huaraz.
Considera que uno de los momentos más tristes es el de su divorcio; sin embargo, ante eso Marisol mostró fortaleza y decidida a seguir adelante inició su negocio con la venta de abarrotes en su bodega que se ubica en la Urb. Los Jardines.

Marizol pertenece al Grupo Mientras Tanto “María del Rosario”.
Con este crédito de S/. 300.00, el cual cancelará en 4 cuotas, podrá abastecerse de los siguientes productos: 1 saco de arroz, 1 balanza de reloj, además podrá implementar su bodega con la venta de pollo y verduras picadas.
texts.en:
Marizol is a strong 35 year old woman. She lives with her daughter in her parents' home which is located in the Huaraz district. She considers her divorce to have been one of the saddest moments of her life. Even so, when faced with this, Marizol showed great strength and decided to press forward and openened her own business. She sells groceries at her store which is located in the Los Jardines neighborhood. Marizol belongs to the group "Mientras Tanto Maria del Rosario." With this loan in the amount of 300 soles, which she will repay in four installments, she will stock the following products: 1 stack of rice, a scale and she will also start selling chicken and diced fruits.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, vegetables, chickens and a scale for her grocery store.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia M. is 48 years old. She is married and has given birth to five children: four sons and one daughter. The two eldest have completed junior high school and are learning trades. The rest are in senior high and basic schools. Her husband is a trader/cocoa farmer. Patricia lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a small farming community called Nkwateng in the Eastern Region of Ghana. The major occupation of the residents, the men in particular, is farming.

She trades in palm oil. She procures the palm oil from the producers in her community and distributes it to customers who resell it and to food vendors. Apart from the oil business, Patricia also treks orange, plantain and cassava to nearby towns.

She wants a loan to procure palm oil in large quantities so that she can distribute it to the increasing number of her customers. She has been in this business for 13 years. Patricia aspires to give her children the best education.

loans.use: To procure palm oil in bulk

loans.name: Vo Thi

texts.vi: Chị Võ Thị Cậy năm nay 54 tuổi, gia đình chị có 3 con đều đã trưởng thành. Chị Cậy tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2005. Trước khi tham gia Quỹ Tình thương thu nhập của gia đình chị chủ yếu từ việc đánh bắt cá trên biển. Sau khi tham gia Quỹ có thêm nguồn vốn gia đình chị đã đầu tư vào kinh doanh tre nứa. Hiện tại công việc kinh doanh đang phát triển khá thuận lợi và đem lại cho gia đình chị thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng.Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 20.000.000đ để đầu tư  mua thêm tre nứa về bán cho người dân địa phương tăng thu nhập cho gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Võ Thị Cậy, 54 years old, has three grown children. Mrs. Cậy has participated in the TYM Fund since 2005. Before she joined the Fund, her family depended upon fishing for their income. Since joining the Fund, she has used her loans to invest in a business selling bamboo. This business is now doing rather well and earns the family an income of 3,000,000 VND (172 USD) per month. In the next round of lending, she hopes to borrow 20,000,000 VND (1150 USD) to buy more bamboo, which they can sell to residents of the local community. This will enable Mrs. Cậy and her family to increase their income.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bamboo Sales

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en: Naomi T., 49, is married with five children.  She has one year of experience in the pancake business. She sells to the village people and school, six days per week. She has not had any previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 180 tala (~$60 US).  SPBD loans are Naomi’s only access to capital because she has never been able to qualify for loans with the traditional banks. She will use this loan to buy supplies to start her business.

loans.use: To purchase vegetable oil, tongs, frying pan, oven etc.

loans.name: Simona Del Carmen

texts.es: La Señora. Simona tiene 39 años de edad, habita en el barrio Enrique Bermúdez en la capital de Managua, tiene dos hijos de 14 y 16 años de edad, su esposo le ayuda económicamente. Con esfuerzo su esposo y doña Simona han ido construyendo su vivienda poco a poco, pero faltan otros detalles que son necesarios para la seguridad de la familia.Se desempeña como domestica desde hace 4 años brindando su servicio, es un trabajo honesto y el cual ella adquiere un bien económico para su familia. Gracias a los préstamos en Afodenic lograr aumentar un cuarto de su casa, comprar materiales como: cemento, ladrillos, hierro, zinc, reglones, entre otros para comenzar a hacer las mejoras de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Simona is 39 years old, lives in the Enrique Bermúdez neighborhood of the capital city of Managua. She has two children ages 14 and 16, her husband also works. With effort Simona and her husband have little by little built a home, but they are missing some details needed for their family’s security. She has worked as a domestic employee for 4 years providing her service, which is an honest job and with which she earns a good income for her family. Thanks to Afodenic’s loans she can add a room to her home, buying materials such as: cement, bricks, steel, zinc and more to begin making improvements to her home.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials to finish a room added to her home

loans.name: Celina

texts.en:
Celina is 53 years old and is married to Eladio Figueredo. They live in the San Miguel district of Carapeguá, and have four daughters who are university students.

Celina started working with handicrafts several years ago. She makes blankets and handkerchiefs from lace, and sends them to Buenos Aires, where her sister sells them.

Her husband is a chauffeur who charters his vehicle to different parts of the country.

With the loan from Fundacion Paraguaya and Kiva, Celina will buy string and thread.

loans.use: Purchase string and thread.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.en:
Mr. Carlos F. is from the city of Carapeguá and lives in the F. Isla district.  He has been selling articles typical of the area such as comforters and other products around the area of Ciudad del Este, Caaguazu and other neighboring cities. 
He has two deliverymen who help him provide his merchandise to about 300 different clients. 
Mr. Carlos is a very independent and hardworking person.  He appreciates the trust that the Fundación Paraguaya has given him, from the first moment until now, as without capital he could not do his job. 
He is applying for credit in order to buy comforters and clothes for the winter.

loans.use: To purchase comforters

loans.name: Glicerio Eloy Honorio

texts.es:
El socio Eloy, pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE UNIDOS”, es natural del barrio de santiago en la ciudad del Cusco.

El socio tiene 39 años de edad, es conviviente tiene 2 hijos y alterna sus actividades del hogar con la artesanía, el tiene una pequeña tienda a una cuadra de la plaza de armas de la ciudad del Cusco, en la que expone sus trabajos y los vende al por mayor y menor, en el stand nº 6, el socio necesita el crédito para poder comprar materiales y así pueda elaborara sus trabajos e incrementar su producción.

El socio se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Eloy belongs to the "Siempre Unidos" ("Always United") Community Bank. He is a native of the Santiago neighborhood in the city of Cusco. He is 39 years old, lives with his partner and has two children. He alternates his household duties with his craftwork. He has a small shop a block from a main square in Cusco where he displays his works and sells them wholesale and retail. He is requesting the loan in order to purchase materials to make his works and increase his production. He is very grateful for this opportunity and promises to fulfill his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to make his craftwork

loans.name: Emie

texts.en:
Emie B. is from the village of Sulipat, Calamba Misamis Occidental. She is 27-years old. Emie is married and has two school-aged children. TEmie owns and operates a service-based business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing  transport services to local community members. Emie has been engaged in her business for over two years.

In 2009, Emie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from PMPC. Emie is requesting a new loan to purchase a transport vehicle to improve the business. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Emie from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: To purchase a transport vehicle

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is 25 years old and owns a small chemist's (pharmacy) in the Pipeline area of Nairobi. Since becoming a member of Faulu, Faith has increased her business knowledge from the training provided. She has requested her first loan of Ksh. 35,000 in order to increase her stock of medicine and attract more customers. She aspires to one day sell medicines wholesale.  On a personal level, Faith would like to live a comfortable life and one day own a home. She describes herself as honest and friendly.




Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable micro-finance institution that offers savings and credit services to more than 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add wider stock of medicine

loans.name: Nova

texts.en:
Nova C., 35, is a young widow from a village called Pulong Saging (Banana Island) in Silang, Cavite. She lives with her three school-aged children.
 
Nova is in the business of buying and selling used cars. But it is her apartments that give her a steady monthly income, covering all their family’s basic needs, including the children’s education. She earns at least 50,000 Philippine pesos a month from seven apartment units, which only started out as two apartment units prior to her joining the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2005.  

She was able to buy a second-hand car and was able to renovate her apartments out of her profits from the business. She has just finished repaying her previous loan with the cooperative and has applied for a new one in the amount of P47,000.  She needs the funds to complete the renovations of all of her seven apartment units to attract good renters.  

Nova believes in the value of education, that’s why she works hard to see her children finish their college education.

About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social-development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: Renovation of apartment units

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Elizabeth es socia del Banco Comunal “Nuevo Porvenir” que esta ubicado en el distrito de Puno, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno, ella tiene 35 años de edad, estado civil conviviente y es madre de 02 hijos, estudio educación superior incompleta, vive en el Barrio Los Andes Jr. Ruiz Gallo 116.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 4 años,  su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, dinero que invirtió en la compra de lanas para la producción de artesanías. 

En este momento ella solicito un préstamo de S/. 1700.00 Nuevos soles, para la compra de lana alpaca de diferentes colores, napa, y lana sintética, etc. Para la elaboración de artesanías en miniatura.

Su deseo es poner una tienda de venta de artesanías y poder exportar.
A ella le gusta la puntualidad y las reuniones
texts.en:
Mrs. Elizabeth is a member of the “Nuevo Provenir” (New Proceeds) Community Bank that is located in the district of Puno, in the Puno province, in the department of Puno. She is 35 years old, has a domestic partner and is the mother of two children. Her higher educational studies are not complete. She lives in the Barrio Los Andes Jr. Ruiz Gallo 116. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for four years. Her first loan was for 300.00 new soles, money that she invested in the purchase of wool to be used to make folk art. This time she is asking for a loan of 1700 new soles in order to buy many colors of alpaca wool, cord and synthetic wool etc. This will be used to make small folk art objects. Her desire is to have a store where she can sell folk art. She would also like to export folk art. She likes punctuality and reunions.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy synthetic wool in many colors and alpaca wool.

loans.name: Luz Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes del grupo Luz Gisely del Socorro L., Rosa María Pérez y Gloria del Socorro 

V.. Ellas viven en barrio Camilo Ortega de Managua.


Luz Gisely del Socorro L. de 35 años es la coordinadora del grupo. Ella tiene una pequeña 

pulpería  la cual quiere ver crecer y ser prospera. Rosa María Pérez de 36 años vende cosméticos  y 

Gloria del Socorro V. de 58 años vende comida y nacatamales.
texts.en:
The members of this group are Luz Gisely del Socorro L., Rosa María Pérez, and Gloria del Socorro V.. They live in the Managua neighborhood of Camilo Ortego.

Luz Gisely del Socorro L. is 35 years old and the group coordinator. She owns a small grocery store that she wants to see grow and prosper. Rosa María Pérez is 36 years old and sells cosmetics. Gloria del Socorro V. is 58 years old and sells food and nacatamales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase grains & household products

loans.name: Mrs. Nao Khun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Fourteen people, who are all living in Trapeang Snao village in Takeo province, make up this village bank loan. They all will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Nao K. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members.

Mrs. Nao K. is a grocer and now she wants to expand her business; thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more grocery goods to earn more profits.

Mrs. Nao K. is 30 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are attending the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband, Mr. L. PoeU., is a farmer who owns 2-hectare (5-acre) piece of land on which he cultivates rice.

loans.use: To buy more groceries to sell

loans.name: Humu

texts.en:
Humu is fifty-one years old. She is married and has given birth to two children, both now adults and out of school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy commercial town called Mampong in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

Humu works to support her husband financially to provide for the family. She is a food vendor, cooking and selling a local dish called ‘tuozafi’, or TZ for short. It is prepared from corn flour and served hot with soup. She procures the goods from nearby towns and sells by the roadside in the evenings.

Humu has been in business for over ten years and wants a loan to procure the food items and other ingredients in bulk.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for making tuozafi

loans.name: Leaia

texts.en: Leaia T. is a 24-year-old woman living in the town of Faleaseela. She is single and does not have any children. Leaia owns and operates a business planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has been engaged in this business for over six years and earns approximately 450 WST a month. Leaia joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,750 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. Leaia is now requesting a new loan of 2,500 WST which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. The loan will be her 3rd from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Melvin Leonel

texts.es:
Muy esforzadamente, en el departamento de Chinandega, el señor Melvin C. se dedica a trabajar en su panadería donde elabora todo tipo de pan ya sea simple y dulce y ofrecido desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana buscando la manera de lograr la satisfacción de sus clientes.
Como todo padre responsable, se esfuerza diariamente para llevar el sustento a su hogar y mantener a sus dos pequeños hijos que dependen de él.
El crédito lo solicita para invertirlo en la compra de la materia prima para elaborar el pan y así continuar produciendo un pan de alta calidad que sea de mucho agrado para sus clientes.
texts.en:
In the department of Chinandenga, Sr. Melvin C. works hard at his bakery producing all kinds of bread and simple sweets to begin offering in the early morning hours. He is always looking for ways to satisfy his customers.

Like any responsible father, Melvin strives every day to maintain his household and support his two small children who are dependent on him. This loan will be used to purchase ingredients so that he can continue making the high quality bread that brings great pleasure to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for making bread

loans.name: Marvin

texts.en:
Marvin M. is from District 2, Cauayan City, Isabela. He is 35 years old. Marvin is separated from his spouse and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Marvin owns and operates a business making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling breads, cakes and cookies to the local community. Marvin has been involved in his business for over 6 years and earns approximately 300 PHP weekly.

In 2009, Marvin joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marvin is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand his product offering. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Marvin from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Claudia Mercedes

texts.es: Claudia tiene 40 años de edad, por lo que es una mujer muy responsable con su negocio, este no es el primer financiamiento que solicito en Fundación León 2000 esta no es la primera vez, por lo que siempre se preocupo por pagar sus cuotas en tiempo y forma. Actualmente se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general ella tiene variedad de clientes, y también tiene clientes que son amigos de ella de esta manera ha logrado contribuir en lo necesario para salir adelante con su negocio. Ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de perfumes, ropa interior, cremas, colonias, sabanas, reloj entre otras cosas. Claudia sueña con que su hijo sea una persona de bien y finalice sus estudios.
texts.en:
Claudia is 40 years old. Because she is a woman who is responsible with her business, this is not the first time she has sought funding from Fundación León 2000. This is not the first time because she always keeps in mind to make her payments on time and in a good manner. She is currently selling general merchandise. She has a variety of clients, and she also has clients who are friends of hers. In this way, she has achieved what she needs to move forward with her business. She is requesting this loan for capital for her work to buy perfumes, underwear, creams, cologne, linens, and clocks among other things. Claudia dreams that her son will be a good person and finish his studies.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Trad, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital for work

loans.name: Tushike Mukono Katushabe Kobra Group

texts.en:
K. Kobra is a businesswoman of 36 years of age. She is married and blessed with four children, three of whom are going to school. She has two other dependents schooling too. 

She has a poultry business, which she has been carrying out for over 10 years. She is using the loan to purchase poultry drugs, feed and chicks to add on to and expand her poultry business. She is improving upon her business by purchasing quality feeds and good drugs for every stage of her poultry's lives. She is an active and promising businesswoman whose dream is to prosper.

loans.use: To purchase poultry drugs, feed and chicks to add on to and expand her poultry business

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria Elena Z. O. tiene 32 años y vive con su compromiso y 5 hijos de 4 años a 14 años.

El socio es un miembro de la ventanilla rural "Juntos Venceremos Comunidad" la cual está ubicada en la comunidad de Santa Deriana perteneciente al cantón Chillanes.  La mayoría de los socios cultivan arroz, maíz, naranja, y cacao en el clima subtrópico como la principal fuente de ingresos.

Crece animales para incrementar la economía de su familia. Actualmente tiene 5 puerco y 10 gallinas.  Hace las compras de los animales de un mes en la ciudad de Bucay, crece los animales, y los vende cuando se gordan y se crecen.  La crianza de chanchos es una profesión dura.  La limpieza diaria y la mantención le absorben mucho tiempo.  Solicita el crédito para alimentación de los chanchos.

Desea construir una casita para los chanchos y aumentar la cantidad de chanchos que tiene para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.

Cuando no está trabajando, le gusta colaborar y participar en las actividades en la comunidad.
texts.en:
Maria Elena Z. O. is 32 years old. She lives with her life partner and her five children, who are from 4 years old to 14 years old. She is a member of the Juntos Venceremos Communidad communal bank. It is located in the Santa Deriana community, which belongs to the Chillanes canton. Most of the members grow rice, corn, oranges, and cocoa in its subtropical climate. It is their main source of income. She raises animals to increase the family income. She currently has five pigs and ten hens. She buys the animals in the city of Bucay when they are one month old. She raises the animals and sells them when they are fattened and grown. Raising pigs is a hard job. The daily cleaning and maintenance takes a lot of time. She is asking for the loan for food for the pigs. She wants to build a small house for the pigs and increase the quantity of pigs that she has. She wants to do this in order improve the family’s quality of life. When she is not working she like to collaborate on and participate in the community activities.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Food for pigs

loans.name: Celia

texts.en: Celia A. is from the village of Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 43 years old, is married, and has five school-aged children. Celia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Celia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Celia is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 3rd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Eda

texts.en:
Eda A. is a 51-year-old woman.  She lives in the town of Had. Sara-et, Himamaylan City.  She is married and has two children.  To make a living, Eda owns & operates a business venture. She runs a general store which has been successful so far.  The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community.  She sells small items in single-use packages, soft drinks, and other items.  Eda has been engaged in this business for over 11 years.  From these activities, Eda earns approximately Php 10,000 a month.

In 1999, Eda joined NWTF to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.    She is now requesting a new loan of Php 15,000.  The current loan will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  This will be the 17th loan taken out by the borrower from NWTF.  Eda plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional capital for her 'sari sari' store

loans.name: Joseph Mwangi

texts.en:
Joseph is a 39-year-old man, married to Millicent, and they have one son. He lives in Majengo-Malindi and he operates a garage. He has been in the business of vehicle repair for 12 years and makes a monthly profit of 15,000 Kenyan shillings (KES). Joseph also provides motorcycle transport services. His customers include matatu (minibus) owners, tuk tuk  (a motorcycle pulling a passenger trailer) drivers and owners of personal vehicles.

Joseph's in his third loan cycle with KADET and was introduced to KADET by a friend. With this loan he plans to use 50,000 KES to buy garage spare parts and 20,000 KES to service old motorbikes. He plans to buy a plot of land and build a residential house with the extra earnings he will get from this loan. A hardworking man, Joseph dreams of comfortably seeing his child educated.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for a garage and to service old motor bikes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua T. smokes fish to sell at Abura. Smoking is another process of preserving fish. Fish when smoked takes a longer time to go bad. To keep prolonging its safety one just needs to keep reheating it under low smoky heat. 

Ekua has received senior high education.  She is married and lives with her three wonderful children. Her husband is a sawmill operator. She helps her husband in taking care of her home. Her loan will be used to buy more fish to smoke for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her trade to reinvest back into her business. 

Ekua did not have enough fish to show because it was a Tuesday. The fishermen do not go fishing on Tuesdays and so she has to wait till the next day to be able to get fish to smoke for sale.

loans.use: buy more fish to smoke to sell

loans.name: God Will Provide Group

texts.en:
Catherine B. is the leader of a group of 5 borrowers called God Will Provide. She is 30 years old and married, with 3 children who range in age from 4 to 12 years old.  She also cares for 3 siblings.  In her youth, Catherine was not able to continue her education past first grade.  She is now attending an adult literacy program in order to improve her education.

Catherine has been selling fish at the Red Light market in Paynesville, Liberia, for 6 years.  She started with 300 Liberian Dollars in working capital but has been able to improve her profits by purchasing fish cartons.  To keep customers returning, she sells them large fish. 

Catherine plans to use her 9,000 Liberian Dollar-portion of this group loan to purchase more fish to improve her business. Her goal and dream is to expand her business to all parts of Liberia.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Catherine is holding the sign.

loans.use: To purchase more fish

loans.name: Anqueira Esperanza

texts.es: Anqueira Esperanza tiene 50 años, es una mujer muy dinámica y jovial, vive con su esposo. Se dedica en la venta de cosméticos y ropa, por lo que su trabajo lo realiza visitando de casa en casa de sus clientes para ofrecer sus productos, adicionalmente el buen trato que tiene ha hecho que capte mucho compradores. Ella está muy contenta con la actividad que realiza, ahora su mayor anhelo es incrementar sus ventas pues así podrá ayudar más a su familia y sufragar los gastos. Este financiamiento lo realiza con el fin de comprar materia prima. Su deseo es mejorar cada día más.
texts.en:
Anqueira Esperanza is 50 years old and a dynamic jovial woman who lives with her husband. She sells cosmetics and clothing by traveling house to house so that she can visit her customers and offer them her products. In addition, the excellent service she provides has helped her to attract many customers. She is very happy with what she has accomplished. Now her greatest wish is to increase her sales so that she can provide additional help to her family and cover the expenses.

This loan will be used to buy materials. Her wish is to get better each day.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Elvia Marlene

texts.es:
La Sra. Elvia L. es socia del banco comunal El Ahorro, hace 5 años fue invitada por su amiga que pertenece al banco comunal y le esta muy agradecida ya que a logrado crecer poco a poco en su negocio, se dedica a la venta de bolsitas y bisutería, vende recorriendo los mercados de la ciudad, trabaja de domingo a domingo desde las 7 a.m. hasta las 6 p.m., son ya 18 años con este negocio.

Nuestra socia vive por un bello sector como es San Pedro del Cebollar en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es considerada como la ciudad más hermosa del Ecuador, por sus calles, sus iglesias, su gastronomía, y su gente que es muy cordial y amable.

Tiene 46 años de edad, es divorciada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos quienes se encuentran de 27, 25, 20 y 12 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos viven en unión libre y en su casa compartiendo gastos y su último hijo estudia en la escuela, con el esfuerzo de su trabajo ha logrado construir su casa propia.

 El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en mercadería para su negocio, su mayor sueño es ver a su mamá con salud.
texts.en:
Elvia L. is a member of the El Ahorro (The Savings) communal bank. She was invited to join five years ago by a girl friend who is a member. She is very grateful to her because her business has grown gradually. She sells little bags and costume jewelry at the city’s markets. She works from Sunday to Sunday from 7am until 6pm. She has been in this line of work for 18 years already. She lives in a beautiful area called San Pedro del Cebollar in Cuenca which is considered to be Ecuador’s most beautiful city due to its streets, its churches, its gastronomy and its kind and cordial inhabitants. Elvia is 46 years old, divorced and has four children who are 27, 25, 20 and 12 years of age. Her three oldest are in common law relationships and live in her house sharing expenses; her youngest son is in school. Her efforts in work have made it possible for her to build her own house. She will use the funds to buy merchandise for her business; her greatest wish is to see her mother healthy.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy costume jewelry: earrings, necklaces, rings, etc.

loans.name: Herminio

texts.es:
Herminio tiene 56 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito agrícola de Cayaltí, una zona que en los últimos años ha experimentado un crecimiento comercial considerable. Se encuentra ubicado a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de cinco años a la preparación y venta de platos típicos. El prepara diariamente anticuchos (meat kabob) y los vende por las tardes en el exterior de uno de los mercados de la ciudad. Esta actividad le brinda de ingresos estables con los cuales saca adelante a su familia. Debido al tiempo que lleva trabajando en el rubro se ha vuelto conocido y cuenta con un grupo de clientes fieles.

Herminio desea realizar algunas mejoras en la estructura de su vivienda, de modo que su familia pueda tener una mejor calidad de vida, por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden para realizar las acciones necesarias para lograr su objetivo.

Herminio es un hombre responsable y entregado a su trabajo. Sus vecinos y clientes le consideran alguien respetuoso y que siempre está dispuesto a ayudar cuando se le necesiten.
texts.en:
Herminio is 56 years old, married, and lives with his wife and children in the agricultural district of Cayaltí, a zone that has experienced considerable commercial growth in the last few years. It is located an hour away from Chiclayo city. For over five years, he has been preparing and selling typical dishes. Every day he prepares anticuchos (meat kabobs) and sells them in the afternoons outside of one of the city markets. This gives him a stable income with which to provide for his family. Due to the amount of time that he has been working in the area, he has become well-known and has a loyal clientele. Herminio wishes to improve the structure of his home, so that his family can have a better quality of life. To do this he has, for the first time, solicited a loan of 1000 Peruvian nuevos soles (PEN) from Edpyme Alternatica, which will help him carry out the necessary actions to achieve his goal. Herminio is a responsible and hard-working man. His neighbors and clients consider him a respectable person and someone that is always disposed to help them when needed.

Translated from Spanish by Jacqueline Demeranville, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to improve his housing structure

loans.name: Remelita

texts.en:
This is Remelita R., a resident of Pasay City, Philippines, is a 32-year-old mother of a highschooler and is married to Marco Antonio R., a driver. By the grace of God, Remelita has managed to thus far support her child’s schooling, at this time working hard to be able to send her child all the way through college, a dream for most Filipino parents. Remelita herself has been a college undergraduate and strongly believes that a college diploma is the best legacy parents can leave to their children.

Remelita maintains a direct-selling business, selling clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through popular direct-selling brands such as Avon, Fullerlife, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, etc. Each customer's order, paid for in cash by the dealer, is then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealers' prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and those differences are the basis of the dealers' income. Remelita's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community, and she earns a minimum of Php1,200 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php14,000 loan which she will use to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. Remelita dreams of being able to give her child a high-quality education through all of her hard work in her business. She also hopes to have her own house and lot someday.

loans.use: To buy orders for her customers

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth R. is a 41-year-old married woman who supports her family selling beauty products. She lives in Brgy. Dakit Bogo City, Cebu with her husband, Roberto R., a checker in a cycle parts shop, and their six children who are between 3 – 21 years old.

A member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007, Lilibeth has improved her living conditions with the help of loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her beauty products, pig fattening and electronic reloading businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She currently earns an average monthly income of Php 7,000.

Lilibeth is now requesting a loan of Php 18,000 as additional working capital for the business. This will be her fifth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon, her previous loan of Php 14,500, paid off well within its term, just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Lilibeth aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the “Dungganon” way.

AAbout NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Irshad's Group

texts.en:
Irshad lives in the small city of Borewala in Punjab, Pakistan in a two room brick house with her husband, daughter and five sons. Her husband is involved in a bike rental business, aided by their eldest son. Irshad does embroidery work part-time to contribute financially to her family. 

Irshad has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband to improve the condition of his business. With the loan amount, he will buy another motorbike to rent to expand his business. He has been running this business for the last 20 years and Irshad believes that her husband can increase his income with the help of a loan investment. She is in her fourth loan cycle and is a responsible loan user of Asasah. In her past loan experiences, she maintained a good credit record and never missed a meeting.

loans.use: to purchase another motorbike for a bike rental business

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel es socia del Banco comunal “Chojchoni” desde hace un año atrás, ubicado en el distrito de Copani, provincia Yunguyo,  departamento de Puno, tiene 50 años de edad, de estado civil casada, no tiene estudios (analfabeta), tiene ocho hijos de los cuales dos son menores de edad (12 y 10 años respectivamente).
Se dedica a la compra venta de animales menores como: ovejas y chanchos que lleva a la feria de Zepita. Con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo comprar ovejas.
Ella solicitará un nuevo crédito de S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles, para comprar animales menores como: chanchos y ovejas.
Su visión es crecer en su negocio. Lo que más le gusta de su Banquito Comunal son los ahorros.
texts.en:
Isabel has been a member of the "Chojchoni" communal bank since last year. The communal bank is located in the district of Copani, Yunguyo province, department of Puno. She is 50 years old, married, and did not receive any education (she is illiterate). She has eight children, of whom two are minors (12 and 10 years of age, respectively). She buys and sells young animals like sheep and pigs, which she brings to the market in Zepita. Her first loan from Movimiento Manuela Ramos ["Manuela Ramos Movement"] was for 300.00 nuevos soles, which she used to buy sheep. She is requesting a new loan of 1,500.00 nuevos soles, which she will use to buy young animals like pigs and sheep. Her aim is to grow her business. The savings is what she most likes about her communal bank.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy young animals (piglets and lambs)

loans.name: Nghiêm

texts.en:
H. Nghiêm Thị (20213050023) is a 28 year-old woman living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - tỉnh Bắc Ninh.  She is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To making a living, H. owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling herbs & spices in the local community.  H. has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3.000.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2008, H. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  H. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,152,000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.  H. is now requesting a new loan of 8,288,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital.  The loan will be the 4th loan taken out by her from SEDA.  H. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand the  business.

About SEDA:
The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Uulbu

texts.en:
Uulbu S. is the single mother of one son. She lives in the Kyrgyz southern city Osh. Uulbu graduated from trade college and worked as a cashier in a local branch of a bank. The breakdown of the Soviet Union pulled down many lives, and as many other people did, Uulbu lost her job. But being a very optimistic person, she considered it as a chance to start a new life. 

With the sum of 10,000 Kyrgyz soms (KGS), Uulbu began her business of selling linen and belts. She worked hard and managed to buy a flat for her small family. In order to enlarge the assortment of goods, in 2008, Uulbu obtained her first loan of 80,000 KGS from Bai Tushum and Partners. This loan was used as intended and repaid without any delays. 

Her activity started to bring permanent profit and the number of customers increased. This fact lead Uulbu to take her second loan from Bai Tushum and Partners, which was also used to enlarge her business.

But in June 2010, when violent clashes caused by a deposed political regime broke out in the city of Osh, Uulbu lost her business, which was robbed and looted. But Uulbu, being an optimistic and hardworking person, didn’t give up and decided to resume her lost business and continue activities. 

For this very reason, Uulbu is applying for a loan of 135,000 KGS, which she needs to restart her business. Despite the many difficulties along the way, Uulbu doesn’t look back and is ready to take a step forward to her future.

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase goods for reselling.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es: Jaime, de 33 años, es un hombre honesto y luchador; es padre soltero de Herlin de 13 años; con quien vive y educa en una casa alquilada, ubicada en la selva peruana (comunidad nativa Centro Pumpuriani). A pesar de su declinada salud, Jaime; sale todas las mañanas desde muy temprano para cuidar sus plantaciones y asegura que muy pronto mejorará. Con la alegría que lo caracteriza, cuida sus plantaciones de maíz híbrido, plátano y café, que hace ya 10 años viene sembrando y cosechando constantemente, los que después comercializa a los compradores mayoristas que visitan sus terrenos de cultivo. En adelante Jaime está planeando construir su casa propia, ya adquirió un pequeño terreno donde los próximos meses comenzará a construir, de la misma manera abrirá su propio negocio de compra y venta de café, con ello piensa incrementar sus ingresos y poder pagar los estudios de su hijo. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP y está muy entusiasta con el progreso de los integrantes de su banco comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, podrá comprar abono natural y semillas de maíz, que en estos días sembrará.
texts.en:
Jaime, 33 years old, is an honest and hardworking man. He is a single father to Herlin, 13 years old, who he lives with and educates in a rented house that is located in the Peruvian jungle (the native community of Centro Pumpuriani). 

Despite some health problems, Jaime goes out early every morning to care for his fields of hybrid corn, plantains, and coffee. He has been constantly planting and harvesting for 10 years. He sells his crops to the wholesale buyers who come to his fields. Jaime is planning to build his own house. He has already bought a small piece of land where in the next few months he will begin to build. He will also open his own business for buying and selling coffee. With this business he plans to increase his income so he can pay for his son’s studies. 

This is his fourth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and he is very enthusiastic about the progress that members of his communal bank are making. With the loan he is requesting, he will buy natural fertilizer and corn seed, which he will be planting very soon.

loans.use: To buy natural fertilizer and corn seed.

loans.name: Ssebastian

texts.es:
Don Sebastian  de 37 años de edad, labora como docente de primaria en la colonia la Fonseca desde hace 16 años desempeñandose con gran responsabilidad y honestidad, tiene 2 niños de 12 y 15 años de edad, ambos estudian su primaria y secundaria, su esposa se encarga de realizar los quehaceres del hogar y del cuido de sus hijos, don Sebastian actualmente està estudiando en la Universidad para asi lograr obtener su titulo de licenciatura en ciencias de la Educaciòn y ejercer su profesion con mayor eficiencia. 

Solicita su 4to crèdito para  construir una habitaciòn para su hija mayor ya que necesita mas privecidad,  

Su mayor sueños en la vida es que su hijos estudien y crezcan en un ambiente sano y que no les haga falta nada.
texts.en:
Don Sebastian is 37 years old. He has worked with great responsibility and honesty as an elementary school teacher in the Fonseca neighborhood for 16 years. He has 2 children aged 12 and 15. They are in elementaru and secondary school. His wife take care of the household duties and caring for the children. Sebastian is studying now at the University to be able to get his degree in Educational Science and practice his profession more effectively.  

He is asking for his fourth loan to build a bedroom for his older daughter since she needs more privacy.    

His biggest dreams are for his children to study and grow in a healthy atmosphere and for them to lack for nothing.

loans.use: To build a bedroom

loans.name: Alonso Edison

texts.es:
Alonso Edison P. L. tiene 34 años. Es soletero  vive con unos amigos, vive  en el cantón de Ventanas en la Provincia de Los Ríos. No  Tiene hija
 
Los miembros de la V.R.C. El Recreo este grupo se dedica exclusivamente a labores agrícolas especialmente a la siembra de cultivo de ciclo corto como es el maíz, arroz, soya y fréjol. Todos los socios son del mismo sector recinto San Vicente Las lomas Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos a esta ventanillas pertenecen 12 socios.

Alonso se dedica a la agricultura especialmente ala siembra de maíz desde hace 5 años. Compra sus productos en Ventanas y los vende en la feria de Ventanas.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueno es mejorar la vivienda.

Le gusta hacer deporte y escuchar musica.
texts.en:
Alonso Edison P. L., 34, is single and lives with some friends in Ventanas, Los Ríos province.  He has no children.

Members of the El Recreo communal bank are dedicated exclusively to farming, especially short-cycle crops like corn, rice, soy and broad beans.  All the members are from the same neighborhood: San Vicente in Las Lomas, Ventanas canton, Los Ríos province.  It has 12 members.

Alonso has been a farmer, especially corn, for five years.  He buys his products in Ventanas and sells them at the Ventanas farmers market.

He is asking for funds to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for his corn crops.  Support from the loan will help him economically to meet his needs. They face challenges like plant diseases and infestations as well as weather variability.  His dream is to make home improvements.

He enjoys playing sports and listening to music.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizer.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia D. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 35 years old. Emelia is married and has 4 children. Her eldest is aged 16. To make a living, Emelia owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Emelia also cooks food that she sells around their neighborhood. She does all this to provide for her family and sustain her children's education.

Emelia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Emelia has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Emelia is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: 10.15.05 Group

texts.en:
Xuan H. T. (55) is a 31 year-old femaL. living in the town of Thanh hoa. Xuan is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 05 Dong Son (10.15.05).

Xuan is married and has 2 school-aged children. To making a living, Xuan operates a family member's specialized retail store, primarily selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community.  Xuan has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2008, Xuan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Xuan has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. She is now requesting a new loan of 3,079,800 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Xuan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Xuan plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  H. T. Huyen (53) is a 33 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her clothing business.

2.  D. T. Hang (54) is a 36 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business of making & selling food.

3.  L. T. Duy (270) is a 26 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her specialized retail store.

4.  L. T. H. Hanh (46) is a 28 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her service-based business.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:
The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Xuan H. T. (55) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh hoa.  Xuan là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 05 Dong Son (10.15.05).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các mặt hàng nhu yếu phẩm như dầu gội đầu, xà bông & kem đánh răng trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Xuan thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Xuan kiếm được khoảng 3000000 VND.
