Cùng nhóm với chị là anh Minh anh cũng tham gia vay vốn để mua lợn giống vì vợ anh chăn rất nhiều lợn. Tiền công đi làm của anh sẽ dành dụm để trả nợ.

loans.use: Buy feed for pigs and more piglets.

loans.name: Kamel

texts.en: Kamel is 48 years old and is doing his best to support his family. Kamel owns and operates a grocery store. He has 4 children and lives in Saida in southern Lebanon. This is third time he has applied for a loan from A. Majmoua. With this loan, he would like to buy provisions and food for his business.

loans.use: To purchase additional provisions and food for his grocery store

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Mrs. María Magdalena O. is a married woman; she is 39 years old. Her husband's name is Rubén Gaona; he is 46 years old. They have three children, all in secondary school. They own their own home where they have a business selling items for fishing and bait.

In 1997, they started a convenience store with Rubén's savings. As the years went on they gradually added fishing and bait items to the store because the clientele were requesting these items, since they live close to the river, in a busy fishing area.

Some years later they formally specialized in fishing supplies, since this was turning out to be the most profitable part of the business. Maria's husband works for the city government. He is the private secretary of the governor and provides the family's income with his salary.

They began to work with Fundación Paraguay in 2003 and comment that thanks to the loans the Foundation has provided them, their business has gone along growing daily. They are requesting a new loan for the purchase of more merchandise since this is the season of the year with the greatest inflow of fisherman to the area.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Maria Magdalena O. es una mujer casada y tiene 39 años de edad y su esposo se llama Rubén Gaona y tiene 46 años de edad, tienen tres hijos, todos en edad secundaria, posee una casa propia y en la misma tienen un negocio de ventas de artículos para pesca y carnadas.

En el año 1997 empezaron con una despensa la cual fue formada gracias al ahorro de su esposo, pero después con los años a dicho negocio fue incorporando algunos artículos de pesca y carnadas, porque la clientela lo solicitaba ya que viven cerca del río y hay mucha gente que se dedica a la pesca en esa zona.

Luego de unos años se dedicaron ya a la venta de los insumos para pesca pues esto le resultaba mucho más rentable. El esposo de María trabaja en la gobernación de la ciudad, el es secretario privado del Gobernador y aporta al ingreso familiar con su sueldo.

Ellos empezaron a trabajar con la Fundación Paraguaya en el año 2003, y comentan que gracias a los préstamos que se le otorgo su negocio fue creciendo cada día. Es por eso que están solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de más mercaderías ya que en esta época del año hay mayor afluencia de pescadores en la zona.

loans.use: To buy merchandise: reels, fishing poles, lanterns, lead weights, fishing hooks, bait and other fishing supplies.

loans.name: Twalha

texts.en:
Twalha is 31-years-old and is divorced with two children; ages 14 and 12. Twalha has been selling fish and soup since 2007. She works from 7AM to 10PM and can earn a monthly profit of about $160.

She would like to secure a loan to purchase more fish and meat for resale.

loans.use: To purchase more fish and meat for resale

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah A. sells maize and gari, a popular local dish. She is married, but her husband's income is not sufficient for Sarah and their four children. Demand for her food products is high and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.

Sarah is asking for a loan to purchase additional food products for resale..

loans.use: To purchase additional food products and expand her business.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Born in 1961, Cecilia is a widow with six children. The greatest challenges she has faced in life are losing her husband and two of her daughters and watching her son fall sick with a mental illness. She made up her mind to turn to GHAPE for a loan to help the remaining children and care for her ill son. Since joining GHAPE, she has taken and repaid six loans. With her previous loans, she succeeded in providing her community with cassava, groundnuts, and yams.

Given this loan, Cecilia plans to buy manure, seedlings, and more land for crop cultivation. She will also pay for labor to assist with clearing new land. She hopes this investment will expand her farm and increase her profits, in turn allowing her to better provide for her family, including her sick son. She also intends on opening a savings account for herself to save some profit for future use. She loan will be repaid in 24 months. The first repayment will be four months after the disbursement of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings, manure, and more land; to pay for farm labor

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad, 23 years old and single, lives in Beirut.

Mohamad works for an electronic equipment company. He works on packaging and delivery of the machines to the company clients.

He is requesting a loan for USD 1,000 to purchase a new motorcycle that will be more efficient for delivering the packages. This is the first time that Mohamed has requested a loan from Al Majmoua.

loans.use: Purchase of a new motorcycle for Mohamad's delivery work

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: For the past eight years, Florence has been trading in the local market of Sunyani in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana. She is 29 years old and married with three kids who are schooling. She is a busy trader who sells palm oil and other products like tin tomatoes, yams, onions, beans and maize on top of a table in the local market. She does not have sufficient working capital to run the business which slows her business progress. With the loan, she wants to inject more working capital into the business to purchase more stock to revive the business. She believes the loan will enable her to purchase good quality stock to upgrade her inventory. She would be grateful for that assistance.

loans.use: Florence would like to increase her stock of palm oil, tin tomatoes, yams, etc. for her small food stand.

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
Maria luisa inicio con este negocio ya que vive en una avenida principal de su colonia y era un buen punto para iniciar un negocio y ella decidió iniciar con la venta de comidas. Ella necesitaba tener un negocio que le dejara buenos ingresos para poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa y así darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hija. comenzó vendiendo en una mesita afuera de su casa aproximadamente hace 15 años y conforme fue creciendo el negocio las ventas se fueron incrementando y así pudo acondicionar el frente de su casa para establecer su negocio.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $475 que pagara en 6 meses para comprar algunos utensilios que le hacen falta en su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria Luisa started her business because she lives on a main avenue in her residential area, so it was a good location for her to get into food sales. She needed to have a business that would bring in good profits so that she could help her husband with the household expenses, thus giving her daughter a better quality of life. She started out by selling food on a little table outside her home approximately 15 years ago. As her business grew, her sales increased; hence she was able to fit out the front of her house in order to properly set up her business.

She needs a loan of $475.00 USD, which she will repay in 6 months, in order to purchase some kitchen utensils that she needs for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase kitchen utensils

loans.name: Rosa Maribel

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 29 años de edad, concluyó sus estudios superiores, es conviviente y madre de un niño de 02 años de edad. Actualmente vive en el Jr. Amazonas Nº 590, distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao, Puno y es socia del Banco Comunal “San Miguel” en Ilave. 

Con el primer préstamo de S/.500 incrementó su capital y compró más polleras y mantas, los cuales alquila en diferentes festividades. A los  25 años de edad se inició con este negocio porque no encontró trabajo y después de dos años tuvo su familia. Actualmente continúa con su negocio y abrirá una tienda más.

Con este préstamo de S/.1,000, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprará 03 juegos de polleras nuevas de Desaguadero para continuar con el alquiler de dichos trajes.  

“Mediante estos créditos hemos mejorado nuestros negocios” manifestó muy contenta Rosa.

Su gran deseo es crecer en su negocio y tener más tiendas para alquiler de polleras.
texts.en:
Rosa is 29 years old, finished high school, is married and has a child who is 2 years of age. Currently, she lives Jr. Amazonas Nº 590, Ilave district, El Collao province, Puno and is a member of the San Miguel Communal Bank in Ilave. With this first loan of S/.500 she increased her working capital and bought more traditional clothing which she rents for different events. At age 25 she started this business because she could not find work and after two years she started her family. Currently she has her business and will open another store. With this loan of S/.1,000, which will be repaid in 3 installments, she will buy 3 new sets of traditional skirts from Desaguadero to continue with the rental of these outfits. “Through these loans we have improved our businesses” said Rosa very happily. Her big dream is to grow her business and have more stores for the rental of traditional skirts.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 3 new sets of traditional clothing.

loans.name: Rajabali

texts.ru: Ташпулотов Раджабали житель города Яван. Возраст 56 лет, женат и имеет четверых детей. Обеспечивает семью путем разведения крупно рогатого скота. Имеет хозяйство , где имеет нескольких бычков. Узнав, про возможность получить кредит обратился к нам за помощью. Получив кредит он планирует купить еще одного бычка. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Rajabali T. lives in Yavan. He is 56 years old, is married and has 4 children. Rajabali supports his family by raising large livestock. He has a plot where he has several calves. When he found out about the opportunity to take out a loan he turned to us for help. After taking out a loan he plans to purchase one more calf. Rajabali plans to pay back the loan over 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a calf

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: La Sr. Maria tiene 37 años de edad, habitante deL barrio memorial Sandino,  en la capital de Managua, casada con un  hijo de 11 años de edad, su esposo se desempeña como taxista ya que es un ingreso mas para su hogar. Doña María trabaja como vendedora de ropa, zapato y tiene una pequeña pulpería inicio con fondo propio con una experiencia de diez años. Sus planes para con su familia es brindarle un mejor calidad de vida y que hijo tengan la comodidad necesaria. En ámbito laboral es seguir brindando buena atención y servicio a sus clientes y adquirí su propio salón de belleza que le permita obtener un mayor beneficio y a corto plazo sus planes son construir su casa y otra modificaciones a su vivienda. Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic lograra realizar la compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, hierro, bloques y brindarles seguridad, protección y un patrimonio a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Señora María is 37 years of age and lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood, in the capital of Managua. She is married with an 11 year-old child. Her husband works as a taxi driver since it provides more income for their home. Doña María works as a seller of clothing and shoes and has a small grocery shop that she started with her own funds and with ten years of experience. Her plan for her family is to provide them with a better quality of life and for her son to have needed comfort. In the work environment, it is to continue providing good customer service and to acquire her own beauty salon that will allow her to earn more profits. In the short term, her plans are to build a house and make modifications to her home. Thanks to the AFODENIC loans, she will succeed in buying construction materials like: cement, iron, blocks, and to provide better security, protection, and assets for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Construction Materials to Finish Building her House

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr: Fatoumata Kanté, 39 ans est mariée avec 04 enfants scolarisés en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Peyrissac depuis 2 ans et demi. Son activité consiste à acheter du bissap, du pain de singe (fruit du baobab), du sucre et autres pour faire des jus et glaces qu’elle vend. Ses revenus lui permettent de participer à l’amélioration de l’entretient de sa famille Elle sollicite un prêt qui sera remboursé au bout de six mois en une seule échéance.
texts.en:
Fatoumata Kanté, 39, is married, raising four children, all enrolled in school. She has been a member of the village bank of Peyrissac for two and a half years. Her business is buying bissap (hibiscus flowers), monkey bread (baobab tree fruit), sugar, etc. to make juice and popsicles for sale. Her income allows her to help support her family better. She is requesting a loan that will be reimbursed at the end of 6 months in one single repayment.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing bissap, monkey bread, etc. to make juice and popsicles

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 43 years old, married to Niba Gideon, and the mother of two children. She lives in Ntamulung, Bamenda, Cameroon. With inadequate parental support during her own childhood, she could not make it through secondary education. Finally, she joined GHAPE at this juncture in her life and, after obtaining training in business management, she obtained her first loan of 40,000 Frs in 2007.Her achievement from this loan was plowed back into her medicine store. Alice plans to invest this loan in the medicine store by buying more medication.

With the profits from this loan, Alice hopes to expand her business and support her children, improve their education, and improve her family’s living standards. She knows she will not have a problem with her repayments because her loan schedule is set up so that her payments are small and regular.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase medicines for re-sale

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokhom N., a 51-year-old resident of Trapaing Krosang village in Takeo Province, is a farmer who owns a plot of land upon which she cultivates both rice and vegetables. Her husband, Mr. Ha Hoeun, is a construction worker. Sokhom is applying for a loan to add to her savings to buy timber to build a new family home.

She has five children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory, while another is a construction worker and the others are attending the local school. Her husband is shown on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy timber to build a new family home.

loans.name: Yuliana

texts.es: Yuliana es una joven soltera, que a sus 22 años, todavía vive con sus padres, a los cuales quiere mucho y desea darles una vida más tranquila. Como todos los jóvenes de su edad tiene muchos sueños, uno de los cuales es tener una profesión, meta que no pudo lograr debido a que no contaba con el dinero necesario, actualmente tiene un negocio de fotocopias y poco a poco su vida está mejorando. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que dispone de tiempo para estudiar las materias que necesita para ingresar a la universidad, espera que su negocio crezca más y tenga más clientes, lleva 1 año en esta actividad y lo que más le disgusta es tener que estar pendiente de que las hojas no se atasquen dentro de la máquina fotocopiadora. Yuliana quiere mejorar su vida y sabe que con mucho esfuerzo lo logrará. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que desea acceder a otro crédito posteriormente, en su banco comunal es una de las socias más queridas, ya que siempre está muy alegre. Con el dinero solicitado incrementara su capital de trabajo y comprará materiales necesarios para negocio; como papel, toner, grapas, etc.
texts.en:
Yuliana is a young single woman that at 22, still lives with her parents, whom she loves her very much and wants to give them a calmer life.

Like many young people her age, she has many dreams; one of them is to have a career, a goal that she cannot reach because she can’t count on the necessary money.

Presently she has a photocopy business and little by little her life is improving. What she likes most about her job is that it allows for time to study the subjects that she needs to enter university. She hopes the business grows more and has more customers. She has been doing this for a year, and what she likes least is to have to be dependent on the pages not jamming inside the photocopy machine. Yuliana wants to improve her life and knows that with a lot of effort she will accomplish it.

This is the second loan with MFP and she is ready to pay all the fees on time as she will want to request another loan later. In her communal bank she is one of the most loved partner members and is always very happy.

With the money requested she will increase her working capital and will buy needed materials for the business such as paper, toner, staples etc.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy the materials for her business / Compra de materiales para su negocio

loans.name: Parviz

texts.en:
Parviz is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the Fizuli region in the occupied territory of Azerbaijan. He is settled in the Kayidish village, which was built for IDPs.

This young, single man has been selling agricultural produce for three years. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to improve his business by buying more agricultural produce: milk, yoghurt, potatoes, and fruit.

loans.use: To buy more agricultural produce: milk, yoghurt, potatoes, and fruit.

loans.name: Sulufaga

texts.en:
Sulufaga E., 48, is married with 9 children. She has 5 years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the village people and public 2 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD, Kiva's partner.

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 160 Tala (~115 USD). SPBD loans are Sulufaga’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase chemicals, weed killer, a rake and fertilizers

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.ru: Мавджуда скоро погасив очередной кредит хочет получить следующий займ. На полученые деньги она хочет съездить за товаром летнего ассортимента.В основном хочет привести детские футболки и мужские сорочки и майки.За все годы кредитования у Мавджуды увеличился оборотный капитал и следовательно торговля.За всю свою деятельность Мавджуда ни разу не нарушила условия Фонда.
texts.en:
Soon after she repaid her last loan, Mavjuda decided to request a new one. She wants to use this loan to obtain summer goods assortment. She wants to primarily bring in children’s t-shirts and men’s tunics and tank tops. Over the years of borrowing, Mavjuda’s working capital and sales have increased. Mavjuda has never violated any of the fund’s terms.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To obtain summer goods assortment

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
Maritza pertenece al Banco Comunal “ LA FLOR DE LA CANELA 2” ,vive en la Urbanización Municipal Mz. A1 Lt. 14 ,ella tiene 38 años y 04 hijos.  
              Se inicio con la venta de pescados  en compañía de su esposo , con su primer préstamo de s/. 300.00 lo invirtió para poner su propio negocio de venta de pescado.
              Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 compró un bote para que ella y su esposo fueran a pescar y así poder tener mas ingresos para su hogar.
            El tiempo que trabaja con Manuela Ramos se siente satisfecha por haberle dado la oportunidad de salir adelante y darle la oportunidad de superarse.
texts.en:
Maritza is a member of "La Flor de Canela 2" Communal Bank. She lives at Urbanizacion Munizipal Mz. A1 Lt. 14. She is 38 years old and has 4 children. She, along with her husband, began selling fish and with her first loan of 300 soles invested in the establishement of her store to sell fish. With this loan of 1500 soles she bought a boat so that she and her husband can go fishing thereby incrasing their family's income. She is grateful for the opportunity that working with Manuela Ramos has given her to get ahead and better herself.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a fishing boat.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Doña Carmen es originaria de la comunidad de la zona uno del departamento de Totonicapán  ella su fuente de ingreso lo obtiene en la elaboracion de canastas con material de plastico ella inicio su trabajo cuando tenia diez años hasta la fecha cuenta con dos operarias  cada semana elaboran ocho docenas las cuales las entrega en la misma comunidad hoy necesita de un credito para la compra de materiales ya que tiene un pedido y para poder cumplir con el pedido necesita del credito para poder cumplir con su patron.
texts.en:
Carmen is from a community in the first zone of the Totonicapan department. She obtains income by making baskets with plastic material. She began this work when she was ten years old. So far, she has two operators. Each week she makes eight dozen baskets which she distributes in her community. Today, she needs a loan to purchase materials since she has an order. To meet this order from her customer, she needs the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana N. is one of the most empowered women of ASHI. Her experiences in her own life - being an adopted child and unrecognized by most of her family members because her parents were poor - pushed her to soar high and be brave in surmounting the challenges she encounters for her own family. Roberto, Diana's husband understood his wife's emotional struggle because they share a common experience. Both of them belonged to a very poor family and have almost fallen or drifted from the real world because of too much insecurity. However, when they both met and got married they found their strength in each other. Diana felt quite secure having her loving and understanding husband beside her. 

When Diana had two children, she gained more strength to fight the battles she is facing - financial, and emotional battles. When they started having their own family, she and her husband had no stable job nor source of income. Life then was so hard for both of them, especially for Diana. When ASHI came to their village Diana's clear vision of tomorrow started to flourish. She saw the bright future for her children waiting ahead of her when she received a loan from ASHI. Since then, Diana and her husband have been venturing into several kinds of business, searching for their success. However, life seemed to be cruel for them, she said, yet giving up was far from her thoughts.

Eventually, Diana found her happiness in life. She was elected as member representative to the Board by ASHI members in Antique, Philippines. Her eldest son graduated from college and was a scholar of a state university. Her second child is in high school and is very active in church. For these things she achieved, Diana was so thankful for the loan she obtained from ASHI because she had the opportunity to enhance the agricultural skills she learned from her husband as well as her commercial skills from being a commerce student when she was in college.

Now, Diana and her husband are farming three hectares (7.5 acres) of rice field. Rice production (planting of rice) is one of their businesses as well as tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar) for hire. Diana has her own tricycle and her rice production business generates employment in their community during planting season. She hires laborers to work with them in the field.

Aside from her rice production business and tricycle for hire, Diana plans to venture in the buying and selling of rice and also a motorcycle-for-hire business. This loan will be used for these things.

loans.use: To buy agricultural products and a second hand motorcycle and to pay for registration and licence

loans.name: Mei

texts.en:
Mei P., 60, has been involved in a business of producing door mats with a typical income of US $1.30 per day in Takeo Province since 2000. P. and her husband work very hard every day to ensure a comfortable standard of living for the family.

P. and her husband are blessed with three children; two of them are enrolled in a local high school, and another one is employed in a garment factory. Her husband operates a business on his own as a door mat seller who has to travel long distances in his province and other nearby places to sell his products. He usually earns around US $9 per day.

P. really wants to take a loan of US $1000 to purchase more door mats for husband to expand his inventory to sell to his customers. By doing this, she hopes that her husband will be able to generate a better income to cover her family's expenses as well as to save to cover her children’s future education.

loans.use: purchasing door mats

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase four cattle.

loans.name: Ousmah

texts.fr: Ce monsieur est un spécialiste de la broderie, plus précisément il est styliste modéliste. Il a beaucoup de clients dont la plupart viennent du Mali et du Sénégal. Il confectionne de bons habits brodés à ses clients. Il est aussi très visité par les clients togolais du quartier Bassadji. Il est marié et cette acticité lui permet de couvrir tous les besoins de ses 04 enfants. Actuellement il a besoin d’acheter une nouvelle machine à broder pour pouvoir élargir ses activités. Il veut aussi acheter 04 rouleaux de fils à coudre ; c’est pour cette raison qu’il demande un crédit de WAGES
texts.en:
This gentleman is a specialist in embroidering. He is a stylist and pattern designer to be exact. He has many customers, most of whom come from Mali and from Senegal. He makes nice embroidered clothing for his customers. He is also much visited by Togolese customers from the Bassadji district. He is married, and this business allows him to cover all the needs of his four children. Currently, he needs to buy a new embroidering machine to be able to expand his business. He also wants to buy four rolls of thread. For these reasons, he's requesting a loan from WAGES.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy embroidering machines and sewing thread

loans.name: Andrelie

texts.en:
Andrelie A., a 29-year-old from Trento, Agusan del Sur, Philippines, started growing rice in 2006. She used her earnings to buy one hectare of rice fields. Her family’s daily needs are met through selling firewood as well. The majority of their income comes from the farm. She just recently joined CEVI; she was aware of the help it extends to farmers by attending the training and making herself a recipient of its financial assistance.

For starting, Andrelie requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to sustain her farm and also buy feed for the pigs. She is grateful she can pay the loan slowly because of the monthly amortization.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en:
Lerma S. is from the village of Lumipac. She is 48 years old. Lerma is single. To make a living, Lerma owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Lerma has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 1,200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lerma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lerma is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Lerma from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries for resale

loans.name: Leónidas Eliseo

texts.es: Leónidas Eliseo S. A. reside en Colón municipio del departamento de La Libertad.  Leónidas tiene 51 años de edad vive con su esposa y tres hijos. Leónidas curso hasta la primaria razón por la cual se le ha sido muy difícil emplearse en algún lugar, es por eso  Leónidas  decidió poner su pequeño negocio de venta de sorbetes que después de doce años, de mantenerlo a flote, ahora maneja un negocio muy estable ,que distribuye variedad de sorbetes a pequeños negocios, el crédito que solicita  Leónidas es para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y lograr expandir mas sus ventas.

loans.use: Surtir su negocio

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en: Christiana is 35 years old. She is married and is the mother of five children. She is a very hardworking woman who works hard to take care of her children. Her children are currently in school. Christiana is a producer of gari grains. She sells gari grains in bulk in a local market. Gari is prepared from milled cassava. She gets her stock delivered from nearby communities and distributes it during market days. She has a large customer base, but she no longer has enough funds to buy more stock. With your assistance, she believes that she could buy more stock, increase her profit, and consequently be able to provide a better education for her children. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: purchasing gari grains

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es:
La señora Elvira es socia del Banco Comunal “San Pedro” ubicado en  la comunidad de Ancara, del distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao, Departamento de Puno; tiene 20 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, tiene 01 hijo, vive en la comunidad de Ancara, tiene educación primaria completa.

La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 8 meses.  Su préstamo inicial fue de S/. 500.00 Nuevos Soles, el cual le permitió incrementar su capital para su negocio de compra venta de carnes.

En la actualidad requiere de un nuevo préstamo de S/. 300.00 Nuevos soles, el cual le permitirá comprar carne en las comunidades de Ilave para venderla allí mismo, esta actividad la desarrolla una vez por semana.

Su mayor deseo es continuar trabajando.

A ella le  gustan  los ahorros y las charlas ya que dice que en ellas aprende muchas cosas para su negocio.
texts.en:
Elvira, 20, is a member of the "San Pedro" communal bank which is located in Ancara, Llave district, El Collao province, Puno department. She is single and has one son. She lives in Ancara and has finished elementary school. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for the past 8 months. Her initial, 500 new sol loan, was used to capitalize her meat selling business. Currently, she needs a new loan of 300 new soles to buy meat in Llave and sell it there; an activity she does once a week. Her greatest desire is to continue working. She likes the savings and the chats because she says she learns a lot of things that help her in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy meat at wholesale.

loans.name: Mayra Damaris

texts.es:
Mayra A. tiene su propio negocio de venta de carne de todo tipo en el mercado central de Chinandega ofertando carne de res y de cerdo a sus clientes que asisten al local para comprarle la carne.
Ella atraviesa la necesidad de invertir en la compra de cerdos para proceder con su destace y extracción de la carne. Por esta razón es que ella solicita el crédito en Ceprodel  para la compra de los cerdos y aprovechar esta oportunidad para ofrecer la carne y así generar ingresos para el  mejoramiento del negocio y por ende de su familia.
texts.en:
Mayra A. sells all kinds of meat in Chinandega's central market; she offers beef and pork to her customers who visit her stall when they come to the market to shop. She needs to buy pigs to butcher and sell the pork meat. She is requesting financing from Ceprodel to buy the pigs and take advantage of this opportunity to offer the meat so that she can generate income for the improvement of the business and thus for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a pig to butcher.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel A. is from the village of Calabayan in Ozamiz City. She is 28 years old. Maribel is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Maribel sells daily-use products, such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste, in the local community. Maribel has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2008, Maribel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maribel successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Maribel is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Maribel's second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice sells drinks. She is 47 years old and married with five children. I. has been in business since 2006. She uses part of the proceeds from the business to help her husband with the upkeep of their house. Alice is a focused and hard worker. She puts in long hours trying to keep her business sustainable. One of her greatest joys is the one-on-one interaction she is able to have with her customers.  She hopes for a loan of NGN 70,000 to purchase more drinks. She thanks you.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Som's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Som T. is 35 years old, and she is the village bank president for a group that consists of 17 people located in Chong Kaoh village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Yon Kin, are farmers who own a 2-hectare field to cultivate rice on. They now face a problem because their field does not have enough water to support their crops. Thus, Mrs. Som T. needs the loan amount of 400,000 Riel from AMK to buy gasoline to run her pump. Mrs. Som T. is the mother of two children who both are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy gasoline

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa B. is a married woman who supports her family by buying and selling sweet potatoes and bananas. She lives in Barangay Suba Calatrava, Negros Occidental, with her 57-year-old husband Romeo, who helps his wife with their business and piggery. They have seven children, aged from 20 to 34 years old, five of whom have their own families while the other two are still single.
Elisa has been a member of Kiva partner, NWTF-Project Dungganon, since 2001. She has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her buy and sell business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 8,000 PHP.
Elisa is now borrowing 25,000 PHP to buy and sell more sweet potatoes and bananas. This will be her fourteenth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 23,500 PHP, which she paid off within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Elisa aspires to improve her family’s living conditions and ensure the family's future's wellbeing by following the 'Dungganon' way.

About NWTF
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means 'honorable'). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them 'Dungganon' – a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To buy more sweet potatoes and bananas

loans.name: Adawa

texts.en: Adawa A. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes at the market and is requesting a loan to purchase fruits and vegetables to sell. Adawa is 27 years old and is divorced. She has five children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en: Thomas is a 37 year old married man with three children. He runs a carpentry and joinery business in Kayole in Nairobi city. He employs two people who assist him in the business, which has been running for seven years. His wife does baking to earn a living. He previously took a loan of Kes.100,000 from Faulu Kenya which he used to expand his business and to educate his two children. He plans to add stock of materials in his workshop where he makes furniture. Therefore, he has requested Kes.35,000 from Faulu Kenya. He sees himself opening a furniture company in the future.

loans.use: To add stock of materials.

loans.name: Karen

texts.en: Karen B. is from the village of Guiwanon, Panalsalan, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is 21 years old. Karen is married. To make a living, Karen owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for her business comes from selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Karen has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2009, Karen joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Karen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Karen is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Karen from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Lenet

texts.en:
Lenet is 29 years old and married with three children between one and four, with only the oldest currently in school. She's been farming for three years now in western Kenya, near the town of Kitale, and she earns most of her income by selling eggs and hens at the local market. She says that the main challenge to her business is the spread of disease through her poultry stock, combined with the high price of medicines.

Lenet requested this loan through Juhudi Kilimo for Kes. 30,000 to purchase an additional stock of poultry. She says that the extra income from this loan will enable her children to get a good education and improve their quality of life. In the future, Lenet would like to buy two dairy cows and be a supplier of milk to the Kenyan Cremeries Cooperative.

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Sriyani

texts.en:
Sriyani is a 45-year-old married woman living  in Telijjawila, in the Matara area. She has one son and one daughter. They are 24 and 23 years old.  

Sriyani has managed a business of selling and making shoes.Ten years ago she started this business.  She co-operates well with others and has a lovely personality. She is very enthusiastic.

She has requested a 30,000 LKR loan   from BRAC Sri Lanka to help her business. She is grateful to BRAC Sri Lanka because of the financial   support it provides to her.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy new shoes for resale

loans.name: Fernando Alfredo

texts.pt:
Fernando Alfredo M. nasceu no Distrito de Boane, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique tem 42 anos de idade, casado e pai de 3 filhos de 18, 12 e 01 anos de idade, o de 12 anos vai a escola. Fez somente 7ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa própria com sua família e sustenta a sua sobrinha que vive com ela. 
Nunca saiu da cidade de Maputo, trabalha como técnico operativo na empresa Aguas de Moçambique ha mais de 15 anos. Não possui nenhum empregado e tem um salário de 7.107.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Ja teve empréstimo no Banco comercial Barclays e decidiu não continuar mais. Conheceu a Hluvuku através de seu primo que é cliente desta instituição a longa data. Este é seu 1° empréstimo no valor de 15.000.00mt com qual pretende comprar material de construção (chapas de zinco, barrotes, portas e outros) para ampliar a sua residência.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para adquirir mais um talhão para construir outra residência.
texts.en:
Fernando Alfredo M. was born in Boane District, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. He is 42 years old, married, and has three children, ages 18, 12, and 1. The 12-year-old goes to school. Fernando only completed seventh grade; he did not continue because of financial difficulties. He lives in his own house with his family and supports a niece who lives with him. He has never left the city of Maputo. For more than 15 years he has worked as an operations technician at Aguas de Moçambique. He has no employees and has a salary of 7,107 meticais per month. He uses this money for household expenses and also manages to save some in his bank account. Fernando had a loan with Barclays Commercial Bank and decided not to continue with them. He learned about Hluvuku through his cousin, who is a long-time customer of this institution. This is his first loan. He is asking for 15,000 meticais to buy construction materials (zinc sheets, beams, doors and other items) to add on to his house. He promises to pay off this loan on time to maintain his credit. In the future he would like to ask for more loans to buy another plot and build another house.

Translated from Portuguese by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials (zinc sheets, beams, doors and other items)

loans.name: 04.10.05 Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
Duoc L. T. (124) is a 48-year-old woman living in the town of Hoang Hoa, Thanh Hoa.  Duoc is the group leader of a 3-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 04.10.05 Hoang Hoa (04.10.05 Hoang Hoa).

Duoc is married and has 4 children.  To make a living, Duoc operates a family member's business venture in the manufacturing sector.  WhiL. not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from fishing & selling fishes to local businesses and community members.  Duoc has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1.000.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2010, Duoc joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Duoc is requesting for the first time from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women a loan of 4.248.000 VND which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings. Duoc plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  N. T. Thuan (125) is a 26-year-old woman who is requesting a 4.248.000 VND loan to support her business in the fishing sector.

2.  L. T. Thang (126) is a 65-year-old woman who is requesting a 4.248.000 VND loan to support her general store.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Duoc L. T. (124) là 48 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Hoang Hoa , Thanh Hoa.  Duoc là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 3 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 04.10.05 Hoang Hoa (04.10.05 Hoang Hoa).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ sản xuất & bán cho các doanh nghiệp và người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Duoc thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 10 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Duoc kiếm được khoảng 1.000.000 VND.  Vào 2010, Duoc đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Duoc đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4.248.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  N. T. Thuan (125) là 26 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh sản xuất.


2.  L. T. Thang (126) là 65 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hàng bách hóa.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials to expand product offerings

loans.name: Antonette

texts.en: 25 year old Antonette C. is from the town of Albur. She is married and has a 2 year old child. To make a living, Antonette owns and operates a business preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Antonette has been engaged in her business for over a year now. Antonette joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Antonette is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Antonette from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business and save for her child's future. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly in recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but, additionally, savings, insurance, and training which are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Atua

texts.en:
She comes from a tribe famously known for its liking for fish since they occupy areas near the water. She is a single mother aged 45, with seven children and her name is Atua. She is the family head with the dream of seeing her children through education with flying colors for a better future. 

Atua is a fishmonger and has been in the fish-selling business for the last 20 years. She has been able to construct a house from the profit from her business. Though her business entails a lot of details from license to medical forms, Atua says she intends to carry on with it and even open up branches in other districts. She is purchasing fish using the loan funds for resale at a profit.

loans.use: Purchasing fish for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase home articles.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene M. is from the village of Dinas, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 39 years old. Arlene is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Arlene owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Arlene has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Arlene joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arlene has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,000 PHP from GDMPC. Arlene is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase feed. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Arlene from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfols and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase feed

loans.name: Adelma

texts.en:
Adelma B. is from the village of Consuelo, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 55 years old, a widow, and has eight adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $180 a month for these activities.

In 1998, Adelma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell.

Adelma is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 5th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Ta

texts.en: Ta L. V. is 33 years old. He has two children who are in primary school. He has been operating a fresh vegetabL. shop for four years.  He is abL. to earn considerabL. revenue from this shop. Since joining our credit program, he is always in the best repayment situation. He wants to have a loan of 6,322,000 VND to invest in his shop.

loans.use: to invest in his shop.

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy B.  lives in the Busega neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is single and has 1 child, who is not in school.  Teddy has a business of selling charcoal.  She has been in this business for 2 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Teddy sells her products from home, by means of retail. Teddy has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy buy more bags of charcoal. She also generates additional income through running a hotel (restaurant).

The main business challenge(s) for Teddy include the high price of charcoal, and lack of customers.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to expand the business and gain more customers. Teddy lives in a home that she owns. She has access to electricity and  piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include medication.

loans.use: buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Amílcar Francisco

texts.es:
El cliente Amílcar Francisco V. L.. Vive en el municipio santa Rosa Del Peñón departamento de león del centro de salud una cuadra al este, tiene 3 hijo bajo su cargo  trabaja actual mente en la alcaldía santa Rosa del peñón desempeña  el cargo como como Contador es graduado como técnico de administración de empresa tiene 5 años de estar laborando en esta institución.
El cliente cuanta con una casa de habitación el cual la quiere mejorar.
El destino del crédito es para la compra Puerta para el mejoramiento de su vivienda. 
Esto le permitirá mantener en mejores condiciones el bien estar de su familia.
texts.en:
The client is Amílcar Francisco V. L.. He lives in the town of Santa Rosa Del Peñón in the state of León, one block to the east of the health center.  He has 3 children under his care and is currently working in the Santa Rosa del Peñón’s mayor’s office as an accountant. He received a degree in business administration and has worked with this institution for the past 5 years. 
The client has a home that he would like to improve.  The loan will be used to purchase a door to improve his home, which will allow Amílcar to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a door for his home

loans.name: Karina Beatriz

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Aníbal San Andrés que se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla y Cuna de Eloy Alfaro el Viejo Luchador.

La señora Karina tiene 21 años, está casada hace tres años y tiene un  lindo bebe de dos años. Viven en la casa de sus suegros.

Ella se dedica al comercio, vende  productos de paja toquilla, para la cual viajan una vez por semana a otras ciudades tales como Guayaquil, Ambato y Esmeraldas donde sus productos son bien apreciados ya que llegan gran cantidad de turistas los cuales son buenos clientes para sus productos. Trabaja tres días a la semana en lo que es comprar, llevar y entregar sus productos. Los productos que lleva son: sombreros, servilleteros, paneras, entre otros bellos productos. Estos los compra a artesanos de Montecristi.

Este nuevo crédito lo va a emplear en comprar sus productos.  Es socia del Banco Comunal hace dos años y le gusta por la facilidad para conseguir los créditos.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
The Aníbal San Andrés Communal Bank meets every two weeks in Cantón Montecristi, the place famous for its straw hats and the birthplace of Eloy Alfaro the “Old Warrior.”
Karina is 21 years old, has been married for three years and has a beautiful two-year-old baby. They live with her in-laws.
She runs a business selling straw goods. She travels once a week to other cities like Guayaquil, Ambato and Esmeraldas, where the goods are well appreciated because of all the tourists who visit. Tourists make good customers for her goods. She works three days a week buying, transporting and delivering her goods. The products she carries are: hats, napkin rings, bread baskets, among other beautiful goods. She buys them from artisans in Montecristi.
She will use this loan to buy her products. She has been a member of the communal bank for two years and she likes it for the easy access to loans.
Her dream is to have her own home.

loans.use: Purchase of straw hats, baskets and napkin rings

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Nuru is a married woman with one child who is two years old.  She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. 

She operates a cosmetic and clothes selling business, going door to door to neighbors.  During rainy season it becomes hard to move from door to door selling cosmetics and clothes. She hopes to establish a shop to sell her products in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 loan, Nuru wants to purchase cosmetics and clothes for resale.  She decided to join Yehu to get loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase  cosmetics and clothes for resale.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.es: Ofelia, de 40 años, convive con Alejandro, de 46; ambos tienen 8 hijos, pero solo viven con 5 de ellos en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Kivinaki (selva central peruana). El trabajo al que se dedica ella, es la atención diaria a una pequeña tienda de comestibles, que hace algunos años, acondicionó en un espacio de su casa, ahí todas las mañanas; ofrece productos de primera necesidad a los habitantes de su localidad; de la misma manera; Ofelia, surte su tienda no solo de comestibles, también, incursionó en la venta de artesanía, como: coronas, collares y, demás accesorios femeninos. Hace 3 años que viene comercializando sus accesorios en su tienda, pero de igual forma, viaja a las ciudades cercanas, como: La Merced, San Ramón; de las cuales, ya está recibiendo pedidos al por mayor. Por ello Ofelia, con la ayuda de su esposo; está planeando ahorrar al máximo, para poder terminar su casa y de esa manera darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Ella, es una mujer muy responsable no solo en los pagos a MFP, sino en cada uno de los acuerdos en su banco comunal, este es su sexto crédito que tiene con su entidad de confianza y, está contenta con su progreso. Por ello, con el crédito que obtendrá, comprará insumos para la elaboración de artesanías, además abastecerá su tienda de comestibles con variados productos.
texts.en: Ofelia, 40, lives with Alejandro, 46.  They have eight children, but only five of them live at home with them in the community of Kivinaki (Peruvian central jungle).  She makes a living by taking care of a small grocery store.  A few years ago she fixed up a space in her home for the store and she is there everyday.  She sells prime goods to the people of her area.  At the same time, Ofelia not only stocks her store with groceries, but also with crafts like crowns, necklaces, and other accessories for ladies.  She has been selling accessories from her store for three years now, but she also travels to nearby cities like La Merced and San Ramon, cities she is already getting wholesale orders from.  Ofelia, with her husband's help, is planning to save as much as possible to finish her house and in this way be able to provide her children with a better quality of life.  She is a very responsible woman, not only with her payments to MFP, but also with all of her contracts with her communal bank.  This is  her sixth loan with her bank and she is happy with her progress.  Therefore, she will buy supplies to make crafts with and also stock her grocery store with various products with the loan.

loans.use: To purchase supplies to make crafts and stock her store with a variety of products.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita, 52 years-old, is from the town of Trinidad. She is a widow and has a 17-year-old child. Mercedita misses her husband but she knows she has to be strong for her child. She dreams for her child to finish college and find a good job.

Mercedita is a fish vendor. She buys directly from the fishermen in her town and resells their catch. She can buy the fish at a lower price and increase it when she sells the fish. 

Mercedita joined Kiva partner CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mercedita has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Mercedita is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to resell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her child's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en:
Shiela B. is from the village of Tabo-o,Jimenez,Misamis Occidental. She is 27 years old. Shiela is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Shiela owns and operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling fish to the local community members. Shiela has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Shiela joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Shiela has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to additional capital for her business. Shiela is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Shiela from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Lucrecia's Group

texts.en:
Lucrecia B. is from the village of Bacolod, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 37 years old. Lucrecia is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Lucrecia is married and has 2 school-aged children. Lucrecia owns & operates a livestock business, raising pigs for fattening and sale. She has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP every four months.

In 2009, Lucrecia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. Lucrecia is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will also be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be her 3rd loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Laon Ole

texts.en:
Laon Ole L. is 43 years old. He is married to two wives and the father of eight children. L. has been farming for the last fifteen years. His farm is in a productive area which has proved to be good for livestock farming.

Laon learned about KADET LTD through a marketing campaign done by KADET staff in his area of residence. This will be his second loan, which he is planning to use to buy twenty goats for fattening, which normally do well in his area due to good climatic conditions. Laon hopes to use the profit from this loan to build a new house and educate his children. His hope and dream is to buy and build rental premises. L. is a young and energetic man who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy 20 goats for fattening

loans.name: Thidora

texts.en:
Thidora O S. N. is 29 years old and is married to Elyakim, 33 years old. They have been blessed with four children: Jack, who is nine years old; Aldy, who is seven; Ray, who is five; and Resky, who is three. Three of the children are in school. Thidora and her family live in Taklale village.

To support her husband in meeting their family’s needs, Thidora runs a small kiosk. Her husband provided her with a small amount of money to buy noodles, sugar, coffee, a variety of snacks, cigarettes, detergent, soap, etc. Besides working at home, she loves running her business, as it generates income for her family.

Thidora sees that she could earn more if she could stock her kiosk with a greater variety of goods. Taklale village is situated in a remote area, around thirty kilometers from Kupang City, and most of the community members in the village are farmers. Thidora is requesting a loan amounting to 10,000,000 IDR in order to stock her kiosk with a larger variety of basic household needs such as rice, kerosene, frying oil, etc. She hopes TLM might be able to help her in realizing her plan.

loans.use: To buy household items to sell

loans.name: Toch

texts.en:
Toch T., 62, lives in the Province of Kompong Tom in Cambodia, where she earns her living raising pigs. She has run this business since 1990, and it has provided her with income to attain her standard of living. Toch T., a widow, lives with her two children, one a clothes seller and the other a fresh fish seller.

Recently Toch T.’s daughter sold nearly all of her inventory to her buyers and now wants to replenish her stock but lacks the necessary capital. To assist her daughter, Toch T. is asking for a Kiva loan to help her daughter acquire more clothes to resell.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to resell.

loans.name: Norma Carlota

texts.es:
Cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Esperanza Para  Superar en el hermoso balneario de San Jacinto, rodeado de una playa hermosa donde el Rio Portoviejo se une con el mar y es visitado por muchos turistas nacionales y extranjeros.
 
Aquí conocimos a la señora  Norma, tiene 65 años de edad, es casada y tuvo 6 hijos ya todos mayores de edad, ella es nacida en Montecristi pero debido a la salud de su esposo tuvieron que irse a vivir a San Jacinto ya hace algunos años.
 
Se dedica junto a su esposo a la perfección y venta de sombreros de paja toquilla, trabajan todos los días ya que el proceso del sombrero es un poco complicado, el cual lo realizan con mucho amor porque les gusta lo que ellos hacen además porque saben que su trabajo es muy apreciado en muchos lugares hasta donde ellos envían sus productos y porque les deja buenas ganancias. Los sombreros en forma cruda o semi elaborado lo compran en Montecristi, los terminan y los venden a turistas que llegan hasta el local y también entregan a comerciantes que los envían a otros lugares.

Este crédito es para comprar más sombreros. Este es su tercer crédito en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos puede financiar su negocio y además  las reuniones ya que en ellas aprende mucho. Sus sueños son tener buena salud ella y su esposo.
texts.en:
Every fortnight the members of the Communal Bank "Esperanza Para Superar" (The Hope To Go Beyond) meet in the splendid seaside resort of San Jacinto, surrounded by a lovely beach where the River Portoviejo meets the sea. The resort is visited by many tourists, locals and foreigners alike.

Here we met Señora Norma, aged 65, married and the mother of six children, all grown up. She was born in Montecristo, but due to her husband's health they had to leave for San Jacinto a few years ago.

Together with her husband she completes and sells straw hats. They work every day, since producing a straw hat is rather complex. They love what they do because they know that their work is much appreciated by their clients and because they earn a good income. They buy basic or semi-finished hats in Montecristo, complete them and sell them to tourists who come to their store. They also wholesale hats to merchants who ship them to their own customers elsewhere.

This loan will be used to buy more hats. It is her third loan with the Communal Bank. She is grateful because the loans help her to finance her activity and she learns a lot during the meetings. Her dream is to stay in good health, she and her husband.

loans.use: To buy straw hats

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
Dominga tiene 67 años de edad. Vive con su esposo en el distrito de Nueva Arica ubicado a más de 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque. Tiene hijos mayores que ya no viven con ella.  

Dirige una bodega donde vende abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad. Tiene más de 10 años de experiencia en su negocio. Cuenta con una clientela establecida y fidelizada. Es muy conocida en su región y cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales.

Desea usar su préstamo para comprar más productos para la tienda para mejor responder al pedido de sus clientes. Ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1,500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Dominga, 67, lives with her husband in the Nueva Arica district located over 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region’s capital.  She has adult children that no longer live with her.

She runs a store selling groceries and basic need items.  She has more than 10 years experience in her business.  She has a well established regular customer base.  She is very well known in her region and she has very good personal and work references.

She wants to use the loan to buy more products for the store to improve her response to customer requests.  She has thought it convenient, therefore, to request a 1500 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy more products for her store.

loans.name: Seneyda Claribel

texts.es: La señora Seneyda Claribel tiene 23 años, es una joven muy trabajadora y que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado mantener. Seneyda tiene una pulpería desde hace 1 año en donde vende shampoo, abarrotería, sandalias, sopas, golosinas, refrescos, gaseosas, jugos y detergentes. Su negocio lo abre de lunes a domingo, atiende desde la 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche. El crédito lo utilizara para la compra de productos varios y así surtir más su negocio. su nivel de vida es bueno, tiene lo necesario y su mayor deseo es seguir creciendo con su negocio.
texts.en:
Señora Seneyda Claribel, age 23, is a very hardworking young woman. With a lot of effort she has succeeded in supporting herself. Seneyda has had a convenience store for 1 year where she sells shampoo, groceries, sandals, soups, sweets, soft drinks, juices, and detergents. Her business is open from Monday to Sunday from 7:00 in the morning until 9:00 at night.

She will use the loan to buy various products to stock her business better. Her standard of living is good. She has the necessities of life, and her greatest desire is to continue growing with her business.

loans.use: to purchase shampoo, groceries, sandals, soups, sweets, soft drinks, juices, and detergents.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es: Orlando tiene 31 años de edad. Vive con su pareja e hija en casa de familiares la cual está ubicada en la ciudad de Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque en el norte de Perú. Orlando vive en la parte rural de esta ciudad. Gana la vida brindando servicios de transporte público en las calles de Chiclayo desde hace más de 2 años. Desea usar una parte de su crédito para el arreglo y mantenimiento de su vehículo. Necesita mantener su vehículo en buenas condiciones para seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio a sus clientes.  También desea invertir en la educación de su hija. Su mayor anhelo es mejorar el nivel de educación que ella recibe para que pueda obtener mejores oportunidades en el futuro. Por ello, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 800 nuevos soles. Orlando tiene muy buenas referencias personales. Con el tiempo, ha ido mejorando su nivel de vida en su hogar debido a saber desenvolverse muy bien con una fuente de ingreso.
texts.en:
Orlando is 31 years old. He lives with his wife and daughter in a relative's house which is located in Chiclayo, the capital city of the Lambayeque region in northern Peru. Orlando lives in the rural part of this city.

For more than 2 years he has earned a living offering public transportation services on the streets of Chiclayo. He wants to use part of his loan on repairing and maintaining his motorcycle. He needs to keep his vehicle in good condition in order to continue offering good service to his customers. 

He also wants to invest in his daughter's education. His greatest wish is to improve the level of education she receives so that she may have better opportunities in the future. 

For these reasons, he has requested a loan of 800 soles ($300) from Edpyme Alternativa. Orlando has very good personal references. Over time he has been improving his living conditions at home as he knows he is managing very well with a source of income.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle and to pay educational expenses for his daughter

loans.name: Valentine

texts.en: Valentine is 32 years old and she has four children who are between the ages of 7 and 14 years old. Her husband works in a communication company. Valentine owns a shop in which she sells several foodstuffs such as beans, Irish potatoes, peanuts and green bananas. She is requesting a loan to buy more foodstuffs such as she has in her shop and hence make more profits.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuff for her shop.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth A. makes a living by selling groundnut paste in her town of Elmina. She is married to a farmer, has four children and has been in her current line of work for six years. She works hard to help her husband pay their children's school fees and the family's utility bills. She will use this loan to buy groundnuts in bulk and hopes to use the additional profit she earns to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts in bulk.

loans.name: Don De Dieu Plus Group

texts.en:
“Don de Dieu Plus” is a group of 11 smallbusiness owners chaired by Colette. Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva to grow their businesses.
