Colette is 51 years old.  She is a widow and is the mother of four children between 14 and 32 years old.  All of them go to school.   Colette has a soft drinks business which she started in 2001.  Her business brings in US$20 per week.  Colette is a hardworking woman who has demonstrated some abilities in business such as organization and good management. She is a loyal client of IMF HOPE RDC and has previously received eight different loans which she has correctly repaid.  

Colette is requesting a new loan to help her increase the inventory of her goods in order to meet the high demand for soft drinks in her community. She is confident in her business. She knows how to attract her customers by offering what they need and like. She is also diplomatic when she talks to her clients.  Colette’s medium-term plan is to open a soft drinks facility in her area.

loans.use: to buy softdrinks to resell

loans.name: Areej

texts.en: Areej is a 32-year-old married woman and mother of three children who lives in Madaba, Jordan. She is a tailor who owns her own shop. Areej is requesting a loan of 1,600 JOD to purchase material for making clothes and better display equipment to improve her product presentation. This loan will help Areej expand her customer base.

loans.use: to purchase material and better display equipment.

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is married and the mother of three children. She works hard to support her family. Rosalia operates a fish-selling business in the Philippines and she earns additional income from raising pigs. She has been sustaining her business activities with the help of her previous 18 loans with NWTF. 

Rosalia is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more stocks of fish to sell. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Silvia Johana

texts.es: Silvia Johanna tiene 33 años, su actividad es ofrecer el servicio de repostería. Hace más de 13 años, que tiene este negocio a pesar de no tener muchos ingresos ha logrado mejorar  cada día su actividad por los financiamientos. Inicio este medio de vida desde muy joven ya que no tenía un trabajo estable que le generara ingresos diariamente. El financiamiento es para la compra de mantequilla, huevos, harina, colorante entre otros.
texts.en: Silvia Johana is 33 years old. Her work is making cakes and pastries. She started her business more than 13 years ago, and in spite of the fact that she does not receive much income, she has been able to improve her business day by day thanks to the loans. She started this way of life when she was very young, since she did not have a stable job that gave her a daily income. The loan will be used to buy butter, eggs, flour, food coloring, and other items.

loans.use: to buy butter, eggs, flour and food coloring.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 54 years old and married. She lives in the town of Bien Unido, Bohol with her family. Her husband is a fisherman.

Virginia sells fresh fish and "tinabal". Tinabal is salted fish, which is packed in salt in a plastic container for days to age. She requested a loan to buy fishing hooks and nets. This will help her husband catch more fish for Virginia to sell.

In the future, Virginia hopes for their business to grow.

loans.use: to buy fishing hooks and nets

loans.name: Danilo

texts.en:
Danilo is asking for a loan to pay for land preparation and to purchase seeds to make his crop more productive. He has been a farmer for 10 years now. He is married with children.  

Last harvest, Danilo earned P 18,000 net income in his production. He did not sell all of his yield so he stocked some sacks of rice for their food consumption. 
 
In the future, Danilo hopes to boost his profits in order to give complete education to his two children so they can live a brighter future someday.

loans.use: to pay for land preparation and to purchase seeds to make his crop more productive.

loans.name: Mary

texts.fr: L'empreuteuse a la cinquantaine d'age.Depuis le décès de son mari en 2002 avec lequel elle n'a pas eu d'enfants, elle vit seule dans la famille de son frère.Elle y a implanté une boutique de vente de produits alimentaires .Elle pratique simultanément l'aviculture avec une trentaine de poulets destinés à la vente mais aussi à l'auto - consommation.Les bénéfices de ces deux activités sont réparties en quatre parts; une part part pour participer à l'entretien de la famille de son frère;deux parts pour renforcer son fonds de commerce et une dernière déposée dans son compte d'épargne à l'IMCEC.Avec ses bénéfices, elle est parvenue à construire sa propre maison qu'elle compte mettre bientôt en location après avoir terminer les travaux de finition.C'est d'ailleurs pour cela qu'elle sollicite un prêt de 100000f afin d'augmenter son fonds de commerce et accroitre ainsi ses revenus.Elle compte acheter 25 sacs de "café touba" et 15 sacs de riz parfumé. Toute son ambition est de continuer à aider son frère et sa famille surtout les enfants qui sont à l'école.
texts.en:
This borrower is around 50 years old. Since the death of her husband (with whom she had no children) in 2002, she has been living alone in the family of her brother. There, she has set up a little shop selling foodstuffs. She also raises poultry with some thirty hens intended for sale or for her own consumption. The profit from these two activities is divided into four parts: one part goes as her share of costs to her brother's family, two parts go to add to her working capital, and the last part into her savings account with IMCEC. 

With her profit, she has managed to build her own house that she is intending to rent out after she has made the finishing touches. It is for that reason that she is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs to add to her working capital and thus grow her income. She intends to buy 25 bags of "Touba Coffee" (a spiced coffee beverage) and 15 sacks of jasmine rice. Her great ambition is to continue to help her brother and his family, especially the children who are attending school.

loans.use: to buy 25 bags of "Café Touba" (a spiced coffee beverage) and 15 sacks of jasmine rice.

loans.name: Sina

texts.en:
Sina is 43 years of age and married with five children. She owns and operates a business planting and harvesting breadfruit for sale.  She has many years of experience in this business. Sina needs a loan of WST $2200 to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 650 talas or US $271 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Sina joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral.  This is Sina's 4th loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase harvesting equipment such as wheelbarrows, shovels, rakes, baskets, and knives.

loans.name: Maria Mavel

texts.es:
María, es viuda,  tiene dos hijos, quienes dependen económicamente de ella, su negocio es la venta de calzado y ropa este negocio lo administra desde hace 3 años.  Por segunda ocasión solicita un préstamo para la compra de calzado, dichos préstamos le han ayudado para comprar la mercadería en el instante que llegue su proveedor, así mismo está fortaleciendo su inventario para ofrecer mayor cantidad de mercadería a los clientes.
La aspiración de ella es tener un local propio con donde atender a los clientes, ofreciendo una atención mejor.
texts.en:
María is a widow and has two children who are financially dependent on her.  Her business is selling footwear and clothes.  She has been running this business for three years.  This is the second time that María has requested a loan with which to buy footwear.  Her loans have helped her to buy merchandise directly from her supplier.  She has been able to strengthen her stock and offer a larger quantity of merchandise to her customers.

María's goal is to own her own premises where she can provide a better service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy different styles of footwear

loans.name: Damiana

texts.es: La Sra. Damiana, tiene dos hijos menores, estudian en primaria, su esposo tiene la actividad de pintor. Desde hace 10 años la señora Damiana  se dedica a la comercialización de, la  venta de maní, papas fritas, plátanos fritos, chipilo, pipocas y haba,  Ella ambula por las calles de la  ciudad de Santa Cruz con  dos canastas llenas de mercadería vende por menor y también por mayor cuando le hacen pedidos. El financiamiento es para terminar de construir su casa ya que les falto dinero para el techado ya que se acerca la época de lluvias,   la Sra. Damiana es una persona muy trabajadora con ganas de superación y están muy agradecidos por la confianza que emprender les da al otorgarle un  crédito.
texts.en:
Damiana has two minor children going to elementary school.  Her husband’s a painter.  For the last ten years Damiana has been selling peanuts, fried potatoes, fried bananas, fried manioc chips, popped corn and lima beans.  She wanders the streets of the city of Santa Cruz with two baskets full of merchandise that she sells at retail and also at wholesale when she gets orders. 

The loan is to finish building her house because she needs money for the roof since the rainy season is approaching.  Damiana is a very hardworking person who very much wants to get ahead.  She is very grateful for the trust that Emprender has placed in her by granting her a loan.

loans.use: to buy plywood to roof her house.

loans.name: Araz

texts.en:
Araz is a hardworking father who is responsible for taking care of his wife and two children. His family is the driving force for his work. Every day, early in the morning, Araz leaves to take care of his farmland, which he irrigates and fertilizes so his crops will produce. When the harvest comes, he can sell good quality products to increase his income.  His monthly income is about 350 USD and his wife and children also help him with his business. He has seven years of experience in this field. 

Araz is requesting a 900 AZN loan to buy seed, fertilizer, and other necessary supplies for cultivating his family’s land and increasing crop production. This will be his second loan and he has a good credit history.

loans.use: purchase seed, fertilizer, and tools

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Nga is a 50-year-old woman with three children, two sons and one daughter. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City and makes money by selling food and soft drinks. 

For the past six years, she has run a food stall T. cover her family's daily living expenses and her children's education fees. The business is going smoothly and she would like a loan T. buy many kinds of beverages T. provide T. her customers.

She hopes this will increase her income, help her T. improve her living conditions, and allow her T. set aside some savings.

loans.use: To buy many kinds of beverages to provide to her customers.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is 38-years-old and lives in the town of Matugga in the Luwero region of Uganda. He is married and has five children who are all currently in school. For the past six years Hussein has been working hard to manage his retail shop which sells food and home supplies to local customers. 

To help expand his business, Hussein has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more food for resale, and will help Hussein to generate greater profits and improve the quality of life for his family. Hussein hopes that in the future he will be able to establish a wholesale shop in the local trading center. 

Hussein is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Hussein who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more food for resale.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: La señora Elizabeth trabaja como profesora en una unidad educativa estatal de la ciudad de La Paz y su esposo es técnico electricista. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de ladrillo, cemento, arena, estuco para  refacción de un par de habitaciones de su casa. Vive en casa propia  la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Tembladerani en la ciudad de La Paz; Elizabeth es casada y tiene tres hijos. Ella es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2005; esta será la segunda vez que su solicitud de crédito sea canalizada a través de Kiva por deseo de Elizabeth.
texts.en: Elizabeth works as a teacher at a public school in the city of La Paz and her husband’s an electrician.  She needs the loan to buy bricks, cement, sand and stucco to repair a couple of rooms in her house.  She lives in her own house located in the city of La Paz’s Tembladerani zone.  Elizabeth is married and has three children.  She’s been an IMPRO client since 2005.  This will be the second time her loan request will be channeled through Kiva as per Elizabeth’s request.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es: Juan es el propietario de un  negocio  de comidas rápidas, que inició en el año 1999 vendiendo solamente sopas y que gradualmente fue agregando otros productos como perros calientes, deditos, hasta lograr la larga cola de productos que hoy ofrece. Su primer capital de trabajo fue de treinta mil pesos colombianos, que había reunido cuando trabajaba como conductor de un taxi., actividad que aun practica simultaneo a su negocio que hoy presenta una mejor estructura de trabajo. Su sueño es lograr la adecuación completa del local y de su vivienda, lo que significa bienestar parta toda su familia. En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva, también primer crédito que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual realizará adecuaciones a su negocio para proteger a sus clientes de las inclemencias del tiempo.  Su mayor desafió  es lograr el mayor bienestar posible para su familia conformada por 3 hijos en las edades de  18 a 26, con los que sueña verlos convertidos en profesionales de éxito.
texts.en:
Juan has a fast food business, which he started in 1999.  He started by only selling soups, and he gradually added other products like hot dogs and finger foods.  He did this until he managed to have the long line of products that he now offers.

His first working capital was 30,000 COP, which he had gotten together by working as a taxi driver.  He still drives a taxi and has his food business.  He now presents a better work structure.

His dream is to manage the complete improvement of his place and his house.  This would signify the well-being of his family.

He is currently applying for his first Kiva loan.  It is also his first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  He will use the loan to make improvements to his business in order to protect his customers from inclement weather.

His greatest challenge is to achieve the greatest well-being possible for his family.  His family is comprised of three children from the ages of 18 to 26.  He dreams of seeing them become successful professionals.

loans.use: to make improvements to his business in order to protect his customers from inclement weather.

loans.name: Rimnan

texts.en:
Rimnan is from Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 28 years old. Rimnan is married and has one child. 

To make a living, Rimnan operates a specialized retail business, selling electronic products in the local community. Rimnan has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month. Rimnan is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. 

In 2010, Rimnan joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to expand the product offerings in her retail electronics store.

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.es:
Ana, vive con su pequeño hijo, es madre soltera, en la vivienda ha instalado una tienda de productos de primera necesidad, inicia desde las 7:00am a 7:00pm, este negocio inicio hace dos años, por la necesidad de tener ingresos para proveer para su hijo todo lo necesario.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería para el negocio como: pastas, salsas, embutidos, condimentos, boquitas, galletas y dulces, esta compra le ayudara a mejorar y fortalecer el negocio, además mejorara la atención  a los clientes.
La aspiración de Ana es tener una tienda más grande, poder atender las necesidades de los clientes, para mantener su preferencia y así garantizar ingresos para su hogar.
texts.en:
Ana lives with her young son. She is a single mother and manages a store where she sells basic necessities. Ana begins her work at 7am and continues until 7pm. She started her business two years ago because she needed to generate income to provide for all of her son’s needs.

Ana is requesting a loan to buy merchandise for her business such as pastas, sauces, sausages, condiments, snack foods, cookies, and candies. This purchase will help to improve and strengthen her business. In addition, it will improve the service to her customers.

Ana aspires to have a larger store so that she can attend to the needs of her customers in hopes that they will continue doing business with her, thus guaranteeing income for her household.

loans.use: to buy pastas, sauces, sausages, condiments, snack foods, cookies, and candies.

loans.name: Isabel Maria

texts.es: Isabel, es una mujer de 40 años,  nacida en Corozal, casad y madre de 5 hijos en las edades de 13 a 19 años; ella vive en Juan Mina, uno de los dos corregimientos en que se divide la zona rural de la ciudad colombiana de la ciudad  de Barranquilla,  a 5 km al suroccidente del casco urbano, sobre la carretera del Algodón, justamente donde   tiene su negocio desde hace 14 años, de  venta de gallina criolla, como principal actividad productiva, además de  un restaurante ubicado en la vía principal. Su actividad es típica en el lugar ya que allí existen varias granjas avícolas. En su restaurante vende espacialmente el delicioso y muy conocido sancocho de gallina, cuenta con dos congeladores para conservar el producto y tiene los muebles y enseres necesarios para la actividad de restaurante, cocina con leña,  que según ella le da un mejor sabor a la comida. El negocio de las gallinas se incrementa en la época de navidad, por eso Isabel  requiere tener un capital adicional, para aumentar la compra del producto y atender la gran demanda de la temporada. Esta es la razón por la cual se acerca a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para acceder a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a esta organización, que invertirá en  gallina criolla,  en una proporción mayor que a la que usualmente compra, aprovechando el gran número de pedidos que sus clientes le han hecho.
texts.en: Isabel is a 40-year-old woman. She was born in Corozal, and she is married and the mother of 5 children, ranging in age from 13 to 19. She lives in Juan Mina, one of the two divisions of the rural area surrounding the Colombian city of Barranquilla, 5 km southwest of the urban center along the Algodón highway. It is here that she has operated her business for the past 14 years. Her principal activity is selling locally raised chickens. She also has a restaurant located on the main road. Her work is typical in this area, since there are a number of poulty farms. In her restaurant, her specialty is the delicious and well-known "sancocho de gallina" [chicken stew]. She has two freezers to conserve her products, and she has the necessary furniture and equipment for her restaurant. She cooks with wood, which according to her gives better flavor to the food. Her chicken business increases during the Christmas season, and for this reason Isabel needs additional capital to increase her purchases of the product and fulfill the great demand during this season. For this reason, she came to the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation to request a Kiva loan, her first financing with this organization. She will invest it in locally bred chickens, buying them in greater quantity than usual, so she can take advantage of the large number of orders her customers have placed with her.

loans.use: to invest in buying locally raised chickens.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a resident of Mombasa, Kenya. He owns a new clothes shop which has been running for five years. He learnt of Milango from an employee.

Hussein is applying for a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to purchase kids and adults’ clothing for sale. The main challenge, especially during low season, is competition, which makes it difficult to find customers.

loans.use: to purchase kids and adults’ clothing.

loans.name: Bokk Ligueye Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 23 Mars 2001. Il  est  constitué de 15 femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.
Madame Haby qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 46 ans. Elle est veuve et mère de 07 enfants. Elle a aussi en sa charge 02 autres enfants confiés par ses parents.
Elle s’active dans la vente de jus de fruit naturel. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, qu’elle pratique depuis plusieurs années.
Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.
Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
This solidarity group was created on March 23, 2001. It comprises fifteen women who live in the same district. Their main work involves small-scale commerce. 

Ms. Haby, who is at the right in the photo with her hand raised, is the group's official. She is 46 years old and a widow with seven children. She also supports two other children entrusted to her by her parents. 

She is active in selling natural fruit drinks. She has good experience in this business domain which she has been working at for several years. 

This loan will enable her to bolster her capital and to develop her business further. 

The profits will allow her to improve her family's living conditions (heath, food, clothing, etc…) and to increase her saving.

loans.use: to buy goods for making fruit drinks

loans.name: Manuel De Jesús

texts.es: Manuel de Jesús vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos; él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y se ha hecho de mucha experiencia que le permite aumentar la calidad de su labor y obtener las mejores cosechas,  el terreno de cultivo es muy adecuado para el crecimiento y desarrollo de la siembra, comercia en todas las zonas aledañas y ya tiene mucha clientela pues las personas lo prefieren porque siempre tiene lo que necesitan a precios realmente accesibles además el servicio es inigualable; Manuel es un hombre visionario con muchas ganas de salir adelante y alcanzar el éxito, quiere hacer que crezca su negocio  que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, insecticida, fertilizante, herramienta etc. Manuel de Jesús es muy responsable y con buenas referencias de pago asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: semilla de maíz, frijol, insecticida, fertilizante, herramienta

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie aged 49 years. She is married with 3 children aged between 8 and 20 years. They all go to school. She is a farmer and she has been growing maize for the past 9 years. Also her husband is a farmer. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to buy a house. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Zinsou

texts.en:
Mr Zinsou M. is a young tailor born in 1961. His very poor parents can’t take care of a large family. He was obliged to stop his studies early at primary school level. Thanks to an uncle who took him as an apprentice tailor, he became a skilful worker and quickly gained experience, and obtained his diploma of tailor embroiderer after four (04) years of apprenticeship. His socio-economical situation did not allow him to quickly be on his own. It took him a long time to get married; today he has three (03) children and has five (05) apprentices in his charge. His life is getting better since he received his first credit of $ 300 which he smoothly paid back. His second credit of $ 550 brought him success and his workshop receives prospects everyday. With his dynamism, perseverance, rigor in the management of his workshop and his well done work, Mr M. is more and more needed, but he doesn’t succeed in satisfying his customers in due time because of the lack of sewing machines. These festive period in which there are increasing demands, constitute a nightmare for him. This credit of $ 850 will help him buy a more performing embroidery machine so that he can be quicker in his activities and mainly improve the quality of his services. The realization of this project will considerably improve his income and his economical and financial potential which will make a change in his social and family environment.

Monsieur M. Zinsou est un jeune couturier né en 1961. Ses parents très pauvres n’arrivant plus à subvenir aux besoins d’une famille pléthoriques, il a dû abandonner tôt ses études déjà aux cours primaires. Il doit son salut à un oncle qui le recueille comme apprenti tailleur. Très assidu dans ce métier, il gagna rapidement en expérience et obtint son diplôme de tailleur brodeur après quatre (04) ans d’apprentissage. Sa situation socio économique ne lui permettant pas de se prendre rapidement en charge, il mis du temps pour se marier et a aujourd’hui trois (03 enfants et a à sa charge cinq (05) apprentis. Sa situation tend à s’améliorer depuis que Monsieur M. a reçu son premier crédit de $300 qu’il avait d’ailleurs bien remboursé. Son second crédit de $550 l’a totalement relancé et son atelier très fréquenté. Avec son dynamisme, sa persévérance, sa rigueur dans la gestion de son atelier et son travail bien fait, Monsieur M. est de plus en plus sollicité, mais il n’arrive pas à satisfaire sa clientèle à temps à cause de l’insuffisance des machines. L’approche des fêtes de fin d’année ci où les demandes sont sans cesse croissantes, constitue un cauchemar pour lui. Ce crédit de $850 sollicité lui permettra d’acheter une machine de broderie plus performante qui lui manque pour rapidité de ses activités et surtout pour améliorer la qualité de ses services. La réalisation de ce projet augmentera sensiblement son rendement et par conséquent son potentiel économique et financier qui rejaillerons sur son environnement familial et social.

loans.use: To buy a more performing embroidery machine

loans.name: Mélanie

texts.en:
Ms. Mélanie A. is a 36-year-old married mother of 4 and cares for 5 other people. Her modest ice selling business provides a meager income and is not enough to cover all the household expenses. She has already benefited from two consecutive loans which were repaid without incident. The sale of ice involves mainly logistical requirements such as ice boxes, a freezer and a generator, among others. For this reason, Ms. A. is asking for a sum of $650, which will allow her to revamp her business, thereby increasing her revenue for the well being of her family.

Translated from French by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Mélanie, âgée de 36, est mariée et mère de quatre (04) enfants et à sa charges cinq (05) autres personnes. Sa modeste activité de vente de glaçon lui génère de maigres revenus n'arrive pas à couvrir toutes les dépenses du foyer. Elle a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits successifs qui sont déjà remboursés sans incident. La vente de glaçon nécessite des moyens surtout logistiques comme entre autres les glacières, le congélateur, groupe électrogène. Ainsi, Madame A. Mélanie sollicite une somme de $650 qui lui permettra de rehausser son activité afin d’accroître également son revenu pour le bien-être de la famille.

loans.use: Purchase a generator, freezer and ice boxes

loans.name: Khamis

texts.en: Khamis M. is a resident of the city of Aghsu in Azerbaijan. This 29 year-old man is married and is supporting his wife and two small children. He opened up a small booth at the local bazaar two years ago selling household items, such as flatware and kitchen utensils. After receiving a small loan from Normicro last year, he was able to double his business revenue. Khamis is now hoping to expand his business further in order to provide his customers with more products to meet all of their household needs.

loans.use: to purchase more goods for his shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy clothing wholesale

loans.name: Silvia Ivonne

texts.es:
Silvia is an enterprising woman with big dreams of moving ahead in the world. She is separated from her husband, and due to the difficulty of finding gainful employment she decided to start her own business selling shoes and undergarments two years ago, joining forces with one of her friends. Fortunately, the two of them have been able to make the business grow, and thanks to Silvia's personable character, their clientele grows daily.

To supply their customers orders and to offer them a quality service, Silvia is requesting a loan of $750, which she plans to repay within six months. You can have a part in Silvia's success. She is very thankful for the opportunity to improve and grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Silvia es una mujer emprendedora con grandes deseos de salir adelante, ella está separada de su esposo y ante la dificultad para encontrar un empleo decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de zapatos y ropa interior hace dos años, asociándose con una de sus amigas, afortunadamente entre las dos han hecho crecer el negocio y gracias al carácter de Silvia, que se le facilita relacionarse con las personas, su número de clientes se incrementa día con día.

Para poder surtir los pedidos que tiene y ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes, Silvia está solicitando un crédito de $ 750 dólares que se compromete a regresar en 6 meses. Forma parte de los logros de Silvia, ella agradece mucho la oportunidad que le brindas de mejorar y hacer crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Bilqees

texts.en: I am Bilqees B. and a mother of nine children. A few years back my husband died due to an undiagnosed disease. We did not have enough money to arrange an excellent and expensive doctor for him. My children consequently had to quit their studies and they started menial jobs to makeup with the household expenses and gather money for their father’s treatment. A couple of years ago I took a loan and started a business of making small bags out of the used clothing. My eldest son buys the used clothes from a local used cloth market. I then make over these clothes into the bags that he sells to various auto spare parts dealers (these bags are used to keep various spare parts). If we are able to buy used clothes in bulk it will reduce our operating costs to half because buying in large amounts is quite cheaper. With the increase in my profits, I plan to marry two of my sons next year.

loans.use: Buy used clothes in bulk

loans.name: Christian Rural

texts.en:
Mr. Stephen Egyir is an auto electrician at moree junction near cape coast. He was once married with two children ages 11 and 8 years but he is currently divorced. Stephen has it own electrician shop where he works on all kinds of car batteries. Stephen is a hardworking man. He also repairs all types of car starters, altenators and sells cutout too as well. He is w well known electrician at moree junction.
Stephen is asking for a loan of US $ 1,000 dollars to enable him purchase car starters, second-hand batteries, car altenators and cutout to enable him meet the demand of his customers.

loans.use: To  buy car starters, second-hand batteries, car altenators, cutouts, clips etc.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.es:
In one of the busiest streets of the little town of Pukará – Puno, we find Teresita offering delicious fruit juices. This hardworking lady is mother to one ten year old son, who is the main reason for her work. Teresita offers a variety of fruit juices on Wednesdays, Thursdays and Fridays from 7:00 in the morning until 4:00 in the afternoon. In addition to this job, she has a small grocery store, an activity from which she gets additional income for her son’s education. Teresita’s wish is to expand her juice selling business, and for this she needs a loan to invest in the purchase of an extractor, a blender and a tricycle to better serve her customers and above all to increase the variety of basic needs items in her little store. Teresita anxiously awaits your response.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

En una de las calles más comerciales del pueblito de Pukará – Puno, encontramos a doña Teresita, ofreciendo su delicioso néctar de frutas. Esta laboriosa dama es madre soltera de un niño de diez años, quien es la razón principal de su progreso.Teresita ofrece su variado jugo de frutas los días miércoles, jueves y viernes desde las 7:00 de la mañana hasta las 4:00 de la tarde, adicionalmente a esta labor se dedica ha atender su pequeña bodeguita de abarrotes, actividad por el que obtiene ingresos extras para la educación de su pequeño niño.El deseo de Teresita es ampliar su puesto de ventas de jugos de frutas, para eso requiere obtener un préstamo de dinero que invertirá en la compra de una extractora, licuadora y un triciclo para mayor comodidad de sus clientes y sobre todo para aumentar la variedad de insumos de primera necesidad de su tiendita.Teresita espera ansiosa tu respuesta.

loans.use: Purchase a blender, extractor and tricycle

loans.name: Thi Nhuong

texts.vi:
Mrs. Nhượng, 37 years old, married with 2 children, is an industrious type. Everyday, she goes around to collect, buy and sell scrap metal. She makes from 2-4USD a day. She also raises few pigs besides scrap metal business. She has never taken out any loan and this is her first time. She is confident that she can handle weekly repayment of few dollars. The loan will be used to buy feed for her pigs.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Chị Nhượng, 37 tuổi, chị có chồng và 2 con. Chị là người phụ nữ rất khó, hàng ngày chị đi chợ buôn sắt vụn và thu mua phế liệu.Thu nhập mỗi ngày chị cũng có khoảng từ 40000-60000đ. Ngoài ra chị còn chăn nuôi thêm lợn nái và lợn thịt. Chị chưa từng tham gia vay vốn ở đâu vì sợ rằng mình sẽ không trả được, tuy nhiên khi có cách thức trả mới này chị đã mạnh dạn tham gia vì mỗi tuần hoàn trả vài chục nghìn chị hoàn toàn làm được. Do vậy, chị đã vay vốn về mua thêm cám để chăn nuôi lợn.

loans.use: Feed for pigs

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica F. runs a food stand at Cape Coast Polytechnic.  She makes traditional Ghanaian dishes for students and has many customers.  Pictured next to her are wrappings for “kenkey”, which is made of plantains and corn.  She is requesting a loan of $525 to buy plantains and corn in bulk to reduce her costs.

Monica is also a member of a lending group called “Faith Group”, which consists of 11 members in Cape Coast, Ghana.

loans.use: To buy plantains and corn in bulk to reduce her costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To invest on more merchandise for her bar and continue building

loans.name: Sharifa's Umoja Group

texts.en:
Sharifa is 46 years old and is a married woman with 6 children, ages 13-31 years old. Sharifa sells fish. She started in 2003. Every day, she works from 6am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more fish for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, Khadiaj and Mwatum, who sell oil and fish.

loans.use: To buy more fish for her business.

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en:
Akosua N. sells fruits and vegetables, cassava, yams, and other food commodities. She is married, but her husband's income from farming is not sufficient to cover the expenses of Akosua and her three children. Demand for her food is high, and she is looking to expand her business to increase her profits.

She is asking for additional capital to expand her business.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Eloisa

texts.es:
Eloisa is a very hard-working person survives with lots of effort. She is a seamstress who has a workshop in her home.

She is a single mother, and has raised her 3 children with lots of dedication and effort. These days they are professionals and with the work they have found they help their mother, who always took care of them.

Eloisa's clientele formed thanks to the quality of her work and the responsibility with which she approaches her commitments to her clients.

She is very well known for her honesty and her responsibility in the work she does. She is also very dedicated to her commercial obligations, as on other occasions when we have had the pleasure of working with her by granting her loans she repaid them punctually.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Eloisa es una persona muy trabajadora que salio a delante con mucho esfuerzo, es costurera tiene un taller de en su domicilio.

Es madre soltera, crió a sus 3 hijos con mucha dedicación y esfuerzo, estos hoy en día son profesionales y con el trabajo que realizan ayudan a la mamá que siempre se esmero por ellos.

Ella es costurera, tiene una clientela formada gracias a la calidad de sus trabajos y con la responsabilidad con que encara siempre sus compromisos para con la clientela.

Ella es muy conocida por su honestidad y su responsabilidad en el trabajo que realiza. También es muy cumplida con sus obligaciones comerciales ya que en otras ocasiones ya tuvimos el gusto de trabajar con ella otorgándole créditos que pago con puntualidad.

loans.use: Purchase of fabrics

loans.name: Joumana

texts.en:
Joumana, 30 years old, is single and lives in Tripoli in the north of Lebanon.

Joumana's enthusiasm and willpower allowed her to defy the community as she opened a shop to sell painting materials, a business traditionally managed by men. She requests a loan of $1,200 so she can purchase more goods to sell. This will allow her to attract more clients by offering them a larger variety of products.

Joumana has been a micro-credit client of Al Majmoua for the past 4 years. She has always repaid her debts on time.

loans.use: To purchase painting goods to sell

loans.name: Regner Lino

texts.es:
Regner is 27 years old and lives with his wife and two children. He is a humble farmer full of vitality and youth. From his childhood, he has been devoted to agricultural tasks, helping his parents. Now, he is the father of his own family, which represents a deeper commitment to sustain the family through this activity independently. Four years ago, he partnered with a group of farmers who produce and then sell food products to large companies. He mainly cultivated potatoes, peas and corn. Another strategy for sales is to take his entire harvest by truckloads directly to the city of Huancayo, despite the low price of products offered in the market. For Regner, overcoming this difficulty is a matter of large volume production and partnership.

This father works hard because he wishes to see his children as great professionals in the future and have his family prosper economically.

He asks for this loan which he will invest in the purchase of manure, fertilizer and everything else that is necessary for the preparation of his farmland.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer.

Regner tiene 27 años y vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos. Humilde agricultor lleno de vitalidad y juventud, desde su infancia se ha dedicado a las tareas agrícolas, ayudando a sus padres, ahora que es un padre de familia, es para él un compromiso más profundo el sostener su familia, mediante esta actividad lo viene haciendo de manera independiente hace 4 años, se hizo socio de un grupo de agricultores que producen para luego vender a grandes empresas alimentarías sus productos, él principalmente cultiva papa, arveja y maíz, otra estrategia para sus ventas es la de llevar directamente a la ciudad de Huancayo toda su cosecha por camionadas, a pesar del bajo precio de los productos que se ofrecen en el mercado, para Regner, superar esta dificultad es cuestión de producir en grandes cantidades y asociarse.

Este padre trabaja denodadamente porque desea ver a sus hijos en el futuro grandes profesionales y tener una familia prospera económicamente.

Solicita este préstamo, que invertirá en la compra de abono, fertilizante y todo lo que sea necesario para la preparación de sus tierras de cultivo.

loans.use: Acquiring manure, fertilizer and other resources for the preparation of his agricultural land

texts.es: Vinicio en la actualidad es encargado de producción de una empresa de serigrafía, él fabrica toda clase de playeras y trabajos de impresión, desde hace mas de 2 años.  Con la experiencia y conocimiento que él tiene, ahora él quiere poner su propio negocio de serigrafía y por eso necesita el préstamo.  El esta dispuesto a trabajar duro y seguir luchando por la vida.  Su sueño es seguir estudiando en la universidad y llegar a convertirse en un profesional de éxito.  En la actualidad él esta soltero, pero es una persona muy formal y responsable.

loans.use: Iniciar un negocio de productos de impresion y serigrafia.

loans.name: Yene Maria

texts.es:
Yene Maria tiene 23 años de edad, estudió quinto año de secundaria, es conviviente, madre de un hijo varón de 06 años de edad, vive en el Jr. Tumbes Nº 250 del distrito de Ilave, provincia El Collao, Puno. 

Debido a la invitación de una amiga integra el Banco Comunal “San Miguel” en Ilave y con su primer préstamo compró dos memorias para su Internet. Desde los 18 años de edad se dedica al negocio, primero empezó a con la venta de ropa (chompas, pantalones, faldas y otros) que comercializaba los días domingos en la ciudad de Ilave y desde hace 04 años hasta la fecha se dedica  al negocio de Internet. 

Con este préstamo de S/.1,200, el cual será cancelado en 03 cuotas, comprará una computadora para su Internet.

Su meta es tener su casa propia, ampliar su Internet y apoyar a su hijo para que estudie.

“El Banco Comunal nos ayuda bastante porque es fácil de obtener crédito, no pide garantía hipotecaria” manifestó Yene Maria, muy contenta.
texts.en:
Yene Maria is 23, she went to 5th grade of secondary school, lives with her partner, has a six year old son, lives in No. 250 Jr. Tumbes, district of Ilave, El Collao, Puno. Through an invitation from her friend she joins the community bank “San Miguel”, in Ilave and with her first loan she bought two memories for her Internet business. Since she was 18, she worked in a business, selling clothing (sweaters, pants, skirts and other) that she sold on Sundays in the city of Ilave and four years ago she started with an internet business. With this $400 loan, to be repaid in three months, she will buy a computer for the internet business. Her goal is to own a house, expand her internet business and support his son’s education. “The community bank helps us a great deal because it’s easy to get a loan without a asking for real estate as collateral”, said Yene Maria, really happy.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a computer

loans.name: Nana

texts.en: Nana is 38 years old. She is married and has 2 children. She owns a farm where she cultivates pumpkin, corn, and other vegetables. Nana is a LAPO Microfinance client. Nana is asking for a loan of N120,000 (S1025) to purchase pumpkin seeds to sow and insecticides to control pests on her farm. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase pumpkin seeds and insecticides

loans.name: Rene

texts.es: Rene tiene 21 años, es soltero y vive con su madre. Se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de pasajeros en triciclo por las calles de la ciudad de Juliaca desde hace dos años, ayudando a su madre en los gastos de su hogar. La jornada diaria de Rene comienza a las 8 de la mañana transitando las calles de la ciudad de Juliaca en busca de pasajeros, y termina alrededor de las 6 o 7 de la noche que es cuando no hay mucha clientela. Lo más difícil de su trabajo es tener que realizar mucho esfuerzo físico, ya que pedalear su triciclo requiere de ello. Rene se encuentra en su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado refaccionará su triciclo, comprando llantas nuevas y refaccionando algunas partes para brindar un mejor servicio a sus pasajeros.
texts.en:
Rene is 21 years old, is single and lives with his mother. For the past 2 years he has worked providing tricycle passenger transport service through the streets of the city of Juliaca, helping his mother with the household expenses. Rene's daily workday begins at 8 in the morning traveling through the streets of the city of Juliaca in search of passengers and ends around 6 or 7 in the evening which is when there is not much clientele. The most difficult thing about his work is having to carry out a lot of physical effort as pedaling his tricycle requires this. Rene is in his first loan with Prisma Microfinance. With the money he is requesting he will refurbish his tricycle, buying new tires and repairing some parts to provide better service for his passengers.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tires for his tricycle

loans.name: Silvia De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
La señora Silvia C. se dedica a atender su pulpería en el municipio de El Viejo de la ciudad de Chianandega donde la visitan los clientes para realizar sus compras y también es visitada por jóvenes ya que también tiene un pequeño negocio de alquiler de videojuegos.
	
Hoy en día el motivo por el cual ella ha acudido a Cepordel es para hacer la solicitud de un crédito que le permita la compra de la mercadería para ofrecerlo en su pulpería. Con este crédito se beneficiará grandemente y saldrá adelante en su negocio que tanto requiere de su apoyo incondicional.
texts.en:
Silvia C. works attending to her small grocery store in the municipality of El Viejo in the city of Chianandega where clients visit her to carry out their purchases and it is also visited by young people as she has a small video game rental business. Today the reason why she has approached Cepordel is to apply for a loan that will allow her to purchase merchandise to offer it in her small grocery store. With this loan she will benefit greatly and will advance in her business that so greatly requires her unconditional support.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchadise for her small grocery store

loans.name: Valens

texts.en:
Greetings from Valens M. in Niboyi sector, Kicukiro district, Kigali (the capital city of Rwanda)! Valens is 56 years old.

Valens gets up early in the morning around 6 AM to start work and closes around 10 PM.This entrepreneur owns a small shop where he sells different fruits and vegetables such as avocados, bananas, oranges, lemons, tomatoes, marrows, and he also sells eggs, soft drinks, and much more as you can see from his photo. He employs one person to help him to run his business.

Valens is looking for a loan worth 500,000 Frws, which will help him to expand his business and to buy more types of soft drinks. This loan will be repaid in 8 months on a monthly basis.

loans.use: Expansion of his business

loans.name: Rem

texts.en:
Mrs. Rem P. is a villager in Tkouv village in Takeo province. She is a pig breeder. Her husband, Mr. Toem Toem, is a farmer who owns a plot of land where he cultivates rice. Even though they try to do work hard, they still earn too little income to provide a better house for their family.

Thus, Mrs. Rem P. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy timbers to build the house. She is 61 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is a construction worker while the other stays at home to do housework. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to add to her savings to buy timbers to build a house

loans.name: Primavera Jr Group

texts.es: El banco comunal "PrimaV. Júnior" es un grupo que esta cursando su segundo ciclo conformada por 19 miembros que  se conocen ya que residen en la misma zona y se tienen mucha confianza, esta representado por la señora carmen quien e la presidenta del grupo. dentro D. las actividades que realizan los miembros del grupo para generar ingresos se tiene al comercio D. productos como ropa, pan, comida, repostería y a actividades como moto taxista, secretaria , profesora, empleado, cajeras y modistas. Dentro del ámbito comercial y D. servicios  existe gran competencia, pero los socios (as) saben como salir adelante gracias a su experiencia y ganas D. trabajar para sacar adelante a sus familias. El destino del financiamiento es para la compra D. insumos, materiales y herramientas para mejorar sus ingresos y poder brindar a sus familias una mejor calidad D. vida. Los socios (as) cumplieron su anterior siclo demostrando capacidad, honestidad y responsabilidad en sus pagos por lo que la fundación agrocapital confía en este nuevo financiamiento.
texts.en:
The community bank "PrimaV. Júnior" is a group in its second loan cycle and maD. up of 19 members who know each other as they live in the same neighbourhood and have a lot of trust in each other. The group is represented by Carmen, the President of the group. Among the activities the members are active in are: the sale of products such as clothing, bread, food, baking and activities such as motorcycle taxi, secretary, teacher, employee, cashier and dressmaker. There is a great deal of competition in the commercial and services' worlds but these members know how to stay in business thanks to their experience and their desire to work to see their families progress. The loan will be used to buy ingredients, materials, and tools to improve their income and give their families a better quality of life. The member finished their previous loan cycle, showing their ability, honesty and responsibility in their repayments and because of this Fundación Agrocapital has entrusted them with this latest loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Hadiatou

texts.fr: Madame Hadiatou L.  est une résidente du quartier d’agoè legbassito, elle est mariée à un monsieur qui est militaire. Afin d’aider son mari dans la prise en charge des besoins quotidiens du foyer elle a entamée depuis 2002 le commerce de maïs et de beignets d’arachide, elle s’approvisionne à l’intérieur du pays notamment  à Mango. Elle exerce ce commerce dans son quartier. Son stock de maïs et d’arachide étant épuisé  elle sollicite son premier  crédit pour acheter 07 sacs de maïs et 08 sacs d’arachide.
texts.en:
Mrs. Hadiatou L. is a resident of the Agoè Legbassito neighborhood. She is married to a gentleman who is a soldier. In order to help her husband support their family, she began a little business, back in 2002, selling maize and peanut fritters. She goes into the back-country, notably Mango, to do her purchasing. She sells her merchandise in her neighborhood. Her stock of maize and peanuts is expended, so she is asking for her first loan to buy 7 sacks of maize and 8 sacks of peanuts.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of maize and peanuts for re-sale

loans.name: Pisila

texts.en:
Pisila L., 46, is married with 3 children. She has 3 years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the village people and public 2 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD, Kiva's partner.

She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 140 Tala (~98 USD). SPBD loans are Pisila’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase chemicals, a pick, a bush knife, fertilizer and weed killer

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Mrs. Editha A., 54 years of age, is a widow and a resident of P4 Gala, Ozamiz City. She had two poster children, one is in high school and the other one is in elementary grade. She is currently enjoying the pension from her late husband who was an employee of the BIR (Bureau of Internal Revenue).

As the sole bread-winner of her children, she engaged in cassava, banana and corn production on her 2 hectares (approximately 5 acres) of farm land and 3 hectares (approximately 7.5 acres) of tenanted land.

As a regular member and 3rd time loaner of Paglaum MPC, she is applying for a loan of Php 32,000 to purchase 12 sacks of fertilizers and to finance the cultivation and production of the said project.

She is planning to extend her land cultivation in order to earn additional income and be able to send her two poster children to college. She also enjoys the benefits, insurance and savings of Paglaum Cooperative.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for cassava, banana and corn production

loans.name: Magda Luz

texts.es:
MADGDA LUZ R. D. S., pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS DIVINAS” vive en el Jr.Miraflores Nº234, en la ciudad D. Pucallpa, tiene 46 años D. edad, 5 hijos, y su pareja es técnico electricista.

Se inició en la venta D. gaseosas, y con el primer préstamo D. S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles compró gaseosas para vender, pero su negocio no resulto como ella esperaba y lo cambio.

Actualmente ella diseña y cose vestuarios D. todos los lugares del país.
Con este préstamo D. S/. 1,800.00 Nuevos Soles, lo invertirá en la compra D. telas, hilos, grecas, mostacillas, lentejuelas y accesorios que servirán para fabricar los vestuarios que posteriormente alquilará.

“Manuela Ramos es una ONG, que apoya a una gran cantidad D. familias, con pequeños prestamos que permite a las mujeres D. esta zona a iniciar, o a mejorar sus negocios y estoy contenta con esa ayuda” refirió.
texts.en:
MAGDA LUZ R. D. S. is a member of the "LAS DIVINAS" Communal Bank. She lives at Jr. Miraflores #234 in the city of Pucallpa. She is 46 years old and has 5 children; her life partner is an electrician. She began selling soft drinks and with her first 300 new soles loan she purchased soft drinks to sell. However, this activity did not have the desired results so she maD. a change. Now, she designs and sews costumes typical of the various areas of the country. With this 1800 new soles loan she will purchase fabric, thread, beads, sequins, etc. used to make the costumes which she will subsequently rent. "Manuela Ramos is an ONG that supports a large number of families with small loans that permit women in the area to begin or improve their businesses and I am happy with this help" she said.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabric, thread, beads, sequins and various docorations for her garments.

loans.name: Maritza Del Rosario

texts.es:
La señora Maritza C. es una dama con muchos deseos de superar su negocio de pulpería el que posee en la ciudad de Managua específicamente en el mercado Mayoreo donde se desempeña en su negocio.

Hoy en día la señora Maritza ha acudido a Ceprodel con el fin de solicitar un crédito para la compra de los productos de pulpería para comercializarlos y de esta manera salir adelante en su negocio el que requiere de su apoyo para desarrollarse.
texts.en:
Mariza C. is a woman with a great desire to succeed in her small grocery business, which she has in the whole-sale market in Managua. Maritza has come to Ceprodel to request a loan to buy grocery products to sell in her store. This way she can get ahead in her business, which requires your support to further develop.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grocery merchandise

loans.name: Firuza

texts.ru: Фируза Самадова проживает в районе Руми. Возраст 33 года. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Фируза более 6 лет занимается пашивом одежды. Муж в данный момент работает на стройке. Фируза шьет в основном под заказ. Клиентка просит кредит, для закупа оборудывания, чтобы предоставлять качественные услуги.
texts.en:
Firuza S. lives in the Rumy district. She is 33 years old, married and has 4 children. Firuza has been involved in sewing clothing for over 6 years. Her husband currently works at a construction site. Firuza sews mainly to-order. Client is requesting a loan for the purchase of equipment in order to provide quality service.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of equipment

loans.name: Majengo Miembeni Group

texts.en:
Habiba is a member of the Majengo Miembeni borrower group in Kibolirion, Kilimanjaro. She is a 34-year-old woman; she is married and the mother of 4 children. Her children are 19, 17, 13, and 4.

Neema started her own clothing business selling blouses 3 years ago. She works 12 hours a day and earns a monthly profit of approximately 150,000 Tanzania Schillings.

This is Habiba's first loan from BRAC Tanzania. She has requested 200,000 Tsh in order to expand her business. With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan, Habiba hopes to save money, pay school fees, and expand her business.

Venisia, another member of the Majengo Miembeni borrower group, has also requested 200,000 Tsh in order to support her own clothing business.

Alisi, also a member of the same group, requested 200,000 Tsh in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es: Manuel tiene 54 años, es un hombre de buen carácter y laborioso en su trabajo, vive en su casa propia con su esposa y madre de sus 6 hijos, además de su nieto de 7 años. Desde niño apoyaba en las labores agrícolas a sus padres, pero cuando formó su propia familia empezó a sembrar de manera independiente papas, arvejas y maíz. Para atender sus cultivos con mucha paciencia se levanta a las 4 de la mañana, que es cuando aprovecha en regar o fumigar, para que a las 8 de la mañana sólo se dedique a remover y quitar las yerbas de sus cultivos. Cuando sus cosechas están listas las envía directamente al mercado más importante y grande de la ciudad de Tarma, donde generalmente logra vender sus productos a un buen precio. Por ello, Manuel se siente muy contento con su actividad, ya que trabaja en armonía con su esposa y todos sus hijos; por eso, para las cosechas no necesita buscar operarios, prefiere pagarles a sus hijos, de ese modo los motiva a que también siembren, pues reconoce que gracias a la agricultura los educó y les brindo una economía sólida. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, él ingresó a su banco comunal gracias a la invitación de una vecina, por lo que está muy agradecido. Asimismo, hace compromisos de sumarse a las reglas del grupo y pagar puntualmente cada una de sus cuotas. El dinero que viene solicitando es para la compra de fertilizantes químicos y 24 kilos de  maíz para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Manuel is 54 years old and lives with his wife in their own home. They have 6 children and also a 7 year old grandson. Manuel is known to be a man of good character and an industrious worker. He has been farming since he was a boy by helping his parents on their property, but when he started a family, he began planting his own crops of potatoes, peas and corn. Tending to his crops requires much patience. He wakes up at 4am to begin watering or fumigating. By 8am, he has moved on to removing weeds. When his crops have been harvested, he sends them directly to the largest market in the city of Tarma where producers go to get the best price. Manuel is very pleased with his work and with that of his wife and children. He does not have to hire workers to harvest crops because he would rather pay his children to do it. He hopes this will motivate them to start their own farms. Manuel acknowledges that agriculture has helped educate his children and provided for his family financially.

This is his first loan with MFP. He was able to join because he was invited by a neighbor, so he is very grateful. He is committed to following the group rules and making his payments on time. The money he is requesting will be used to buy chemical fertilizers and 24 kilos of corn for the next planting.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma C. is 37 years old CEVI client from Talibon Bohol. Before her first loan in CEVI it was difficult to start a business. Now, she is a boat operator where she earn income from passengers who keep going to their small island. 

She requested a loan of Php 10,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to have a boat repair. 

She said she likes CEVI policies especially that they are offering the lowest interest rate which is 2% a month.

loans.use: having a boat repair

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 45 year-old Judy M. from Mbeya. She is a widow with five children between the ages of 17 and 28. Since 2000, Judy has been running a business purchasing and selling crops. She works at the business for 9-12 hours per day, six days a week and is assisted by two employees. Judy currently earns about 200 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase crops in bulk. In the future, she plans to improve the quality of her business. Judy thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future

loans.use: To purchase bulk crops

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene S. is from the village of Bato. She is 22 years old. Irene is married and has 1 infant-aged children. To make a living, Irene owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting rice for sale. Irene has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Irene joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Irene is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Irene from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Celica Delicia

texts.es: La señora Celica Delicia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Palmeritas II”, Distrito D. la Banda D. Shilcayo, Provincia San Martin, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 53 años y es madre D. 08 hijos, 03 que están estudiando y dependen D. ella. Celica Delicia, una mujer trabajadora y luchadora decidió vender comida, en un ambiente muy bien acondicionado, ubicado en su misma casa, ella nos cuenta que a diario tiene muy buenas ventas, es conocida por la sazón rica que le da a sus preparados y sus principales clientes son los mismos trabajadores D. este centro D. salud y moradores.Esta muy contenta con el trabajo que realiza día a día. Es ella quien personalmente atienD. a sus clientes con el carisma que le caracteriza.Con este préstamo D. S/. 800.00, comprará insumos para la preparación diaria D. sus alimentos como arroz en kilos, azúcar; aceites en galones, sacos D. papa, pollos en javas, verduras y también  algunos utensilios  para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. Se siente llena D. vida y con ganas D. seguir adelante aun, tiene muchos sueños y metas en su vida. Agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos por contribuir  en iniciar su negocio.
texts.en:
Celica Delicia is a member of the “Las Palmeritas II” Communal Bank, Banda D. Shilcayo District, San Martin Province, Department of San Martín. She is 53 years old and married with 8 children, three of whom are still in school and dependent on her. Celica Delicia, who is a hardworking and tenacious woman, decided to sell food in a very well-equipped space located within her own home. She tells us that her daily sales are very good, and she is known for the delicious seasoning she adds to her dishes. Her customers are mainly workers at the local health clinic and nearby residents. She is very happy with the work she does each day. She personally serves her customers with the charisma that is typical of her. With this loan of 800 Peruvian soles, she will buy supplies for her daily food preparation, such as rice and sugar by the kilo, gallons of cooking oil, sacks of potatoes, packaged chickens, and vegetables, as well as some utensils that will help her carry out her business and proviD. better service to her customers. She feels that she is full of life and still has a strong desire to get ahead, with many dreams and goals for her life. She thanks the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her start her business.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing supplies

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is 38 years old and she is married with six children. She is a commercial tailor and she also sells tailoring materials and sarongs of various colors to her customers. Stella hopes to be a big designer in the future.

This is the high season for Stella’s business and she hopes to make more profits. She needs a loan of N100,000 to purchase more tailoring materials and sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials and sarongs to sell

loans.name: Claudia Carolina

texts.en: Claudia is 30 years old and has two children, ages 7 and 9. She has had her clothing sale business for two years. She sells women’s clothing, such as blouses, shoes, and dresses, as well as perfumes. The business arose from the need to increase her family’s income because her husband could not support the family with what he was earning. This loan will go towards the purchase of more clothing inventory. Claudia’s daughter is frequently ill, challenging both the family and Claudia’s business. Her dream is for her family's well being. Claudia wants to see them continue to do well and stay together through the difficulties that life brings.

loans.use: Purchase more clothing inventory

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
Maura tiene 48 años, vive con su hija de 5 años en la casa que heredó de su madre.
Desde hace 6 años ejerce la profesión de docente y paralelo a ello se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, siendo sus colegas sus principales clientes.
Maura disfruta mucho de su trabajo diario con los niños a quienes enseña, pero también este lugar es el medio para ofrecer sus productos. Ella utiliza el catálogo de la línea cosmética para la que trabaja y luego pacta con cada una de sus clientes el pago al crédito. De esta manera obtiene los ingresos necesarios para sostener a su pequeña hija. 
Para el futuro, Maura desea vender ropa además de los cosméticos, para ello seguirá trabajando duro para reunir el capital necesario y adquirir una buena cantidad de prendas de vestir. 

Esta es la séptima oportunidad en que tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella está muy contenta renovar su crédito y seguir siendo parte de su banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita lo utilizará en la compra de mayor cantidad de productos de belleza para tener en stock.
texts.en:
Maura is 48 years old and lives with her five-year old daughter in the house that she inherited from her mother. For six years she has worked as a teacher while also selling cosmetics. Her co-workers are her main clients. Maura takes great joy in her daily work with the children that she teaches, and it is also where she can sell her products. She uses a catalogue from a cosmetic line and then allows her clients to pay by credit. This way she earns the money necessary to provide for her young daughter. In the future, Maura wishes to sell clothing as well as cosmetics. With this goal in mind, she will continue to work hard to assemble the necessary capital and acquire a large quantity of clothing. This is the seventh loan she has received from MFP. She is happy to renew her credit and continue being a part of the community bank. The money from this loan will be used to buy more beauty products to have in stock.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory of cosmetic products

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Mrs. S. and her family live in a small wooden house, located in a rural area of Phnom Penh City. S., 34, helps provide for her two children by working as a garment worker. Two of her children are still single, living in the family home and are dependent on her income. She is married to Phally, 45, who earns a living as a motor-taxi driver. The whole family's living conditions are not good because their house too old and small for them. Because of this, S. has decided to request a loan on Kiva to be used to repair her old house.

loans.use: To repair her old house

loans.name: Jacaranda Group

texts.es:
El Banco D. emprendimiento D. JACARANDA se compone por una mesa directiva: La Presidenta es la Señora Rosio que se dedica a la venta en tienda D. barrio,que vive en casa familiar junto a su esposo y su  hijo en la zona D. santa ana los dos comparten los gastos del hogar. 

La Secretaria  es la Señora Wendy que se dedica a la artesania y venta D. temporada durante 6 años ella venD. en ferias que se realizan en distintos lugares con esta actividad colabora con los gastos D. la casa, vive en casa D. sus suegros en la zona central junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos.

El Tesorero es el Señor Jose Luis el se dedica a la  venta D. celulares y es tambien transportista se dedica a esta actividad durante 18 años  vive en casa D. anticretico junto a su esposa  y sus 4 hijos en la zona D. colquiri norte. El grupo es dinamico y sus integrantes se apoyan ya que se encuentra bien organizado
texts.en:
The Jacaranda comunal bank is composed of a board of directors: The president is Rocio, who is involved in sales in a neighborhood store. She lives in a house together with her husband and son in the Santa Ana zone. The two share the household expenses.

The secretary is Wendy, who has worked in handicrafts and seasonal sales for 6 years. She sells her products in different local markets and this contributes to the household expenses. She lives in her in-laws’ house in the central zone, together with her husband and two children.

The treasurer is Jose Luis, who works in cell phone sales and also in transport. He has been involved in these for 18 years. He lives in an anticrético (a special rental arrangement available in Bolivia) in the Colquiri Norte zone, together with his wife and four children.

The group is dymanic and its members support each other, as they are well organized.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Ngô's Group

texts.en:
T. Ngô Thị (20209050051) is a 53-year-old female living in the town of Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. T. is the leader of a two-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, SEDA. While both members of the group receive an individual loan, they are both responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if they are delinquent or default. The official name of this borrowing group is Vọng Nguyệt 3 - Nhóm 03 (3).
T. is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, T. owns and operates a tailoring business. The main source of income for the business comes from providing general alteration and tailoring services to local community members. T. has been engaged in this business for over 15 years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.
In 2008, T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,256,000 VND from SEDA. This loan was used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. She is now requesting a new loan of 5,152,000 VND, which will also be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. The loan will be her third from SEDA. T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About the other borrower in the group
1. Nguyễn Thị L. (20209050052) is a 50-year-old female who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

About SEDA
The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders. T. Ngô Thị (20209050051) là 53 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy sống ở T. phố Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. T. là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 2 các T. viên. Mặc dù mỗi T. viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các T. viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ.. Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Vọng Nguyệt 3 - Nhóm 03 (3). Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ may vá quần áo thông thường cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương. T. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 15 năm. Từ các hoạt động này, T. kiếm được khoảng 2.000.000 VND. Vào 2008, T. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy. T. đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 4.256.000 VND từ SEDA. Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua vải & vật L. bổ sung. Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay sẽ là 3rd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA. Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm: 1. Nguyễn Thị L. (20209050052) là 50 tuổi nữ. Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND. Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp. Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc. Về SEDA: Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam *Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. . Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva. .

loans.use: To purchase additional fabrics and materials

loans.name: Judith Sakina

texts.en:
Judith Sakina L. is a poultry farmer in Manyole, Busia District, Kenya. She started her business in 2008 as a source of income generation after having lost her job. She is a also a mother of 6 children and married.

Judith would like a loan of KShs. 20,000 which will go to constructing new poultry structures to expand her business. Her future plan is to venture into raising goats.

loans.use: To build poultry Structure.

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Keo P., age 41, is married and resides with her husband in the Takeo Province of Cambodia. She has three children. She is engaged in selling handmade brooms, earning approximately 1.5 USD per day. By doing this, she is able to cover family expenses, especially for her children's education. She has been in this business since 1998. Their standard of living has improved, since P. has been in her business. P.'s husband is a construction worker, earning an income of 3 USD per day. P. is requesting a loan of 500 USD to purchase a motorbike for her husband to commute to work. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a Kiva field partner.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband to commute to work

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret W. M. is 47 years old. She has three children who range in age from 20 to 25 years old. She makes a living in the town of Ngong, Kenya by raising cows and selling their milk. She would like to diversify her business by applying for a loan of Kes 40,000 to buy inventory for a new retail shop. While she does this, she hopes to continue to engage in her true passion, which is dairy farming. She works very hard to keep her business doing well and hopes to make all her dreams come true.

loans.use: To open a new retail shop.

loans.name: Siupolu

texts.en:
Siupolu C. is 36 and married with 6 children.  She owns a business venture, providing clothing alteration & tailoring services to local community members.  Siupolu has 4 years of experience in this business.  Siupolu needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase additional fabrics & materials.
